author: Ryan L.
title: Falling apart in 6 months.
content: Enjoyed using these while running, as they still allow me to hear what's going on around me. In the past week, the rubber cover for the speaker has come unglued, and now they're no longer usable. The warranty period apparently ended after 6 months, which is just about exactly how long these last. For the price, I would look elsewhere.

author: Neon Glitch
title: Returning This Product
content: Terrible sound quality. It is light weight because it is made of very cheap material. Would not recommend. I am currently in the process of returning this item.

author: C. Stevenson
title: I'll keep it BUT what u should know
content:
1- Get the mini or else it will protrude and u cant lay your head back without hitting it and then u will need to re-adjust it.
2- The higher the volume it will vibrate.
3- Doesn't get loud enough.

author: James R.
title: Life changing!
content:
These headphones are a necessity!  I have a long commute every day, and these are great for any phone calls I have to make.  The clarity is great, and everyone, including my hard of hearing dad, hears just fine.  I love these for working out.  I either listen to music or an audiobook and I just go.  I work at a place where I need to be aware of my environment such as phone calls and customers coming into the store, and these help my workday go by much faster but I'm still able to perform at a high level and finish the day strong because of my increased happiness from the music!  I also love the ability to access siri through these things.  When you hold down the main button the headphones say "voice dial", but in essence you've accessed Siri or whatever you have on your device.  You can then tell your phone to do whatever you need just like you regularly do.
Love this device, and I can't wait to see any new product releases in the future!

author: jonathan
title: Cool beans.
content:
I needed to purchase these for my work and the amount of noise there is incredible. Considering that these have worked surprisingly well! If I had to discribe the sound quality it's subpar unless you are using ear plugs. With these being bone conduction they work a lot better and sound 100x better while wearing ear plugs.  There is a downside to that though since this causes added pressure which causes some irritation.

The size honestly for me seemed perfect but they also looked a little small to me so I was surprised with how well they fit.

Not sure why people are complaining about noise cancelation as there is no genuine way for these to do so unless you count the ear plugs they came with as noise cancelation.

 As an over all I thought these headphones were great.

author: Mags
title: Knockoffs?
content: I tries these at a store and they were awesome. The sound just came from the vibration, which I liked because then you didnt have ear pieces where everyone around you could hear the music. These are not that. They dont vibrate at all and the sound just comes out of speakers near the ears so basically everyone around you can hear what you're listening to. I can just hold them in my hand and hear everything. Not bone conducting headphones at all and not the aftershokz that I tried at the store, either.

author: Rajagopal
title: Free massages, courtesy every bassist ever.
content:
If you're a bass player, get your friends a pair of these, and they'll finally pay attention to what you're playing. The headphones noticeably vibrate at high volume, and the bass notes and percussion come through really well.

In seriousness, wish they were a tad lighter.

author: Maria Carreras
title: Not great
content: This is my second pair of this brand but sadly the sound is below part. It sounds fine when i am at the house but when i go to the gym the sound breaks.

author: Kristina
title: Look elsewhere for headphones
content: Terribly uncomfortable. Probably the most expensive thing I’ve bought on amazon that I don’t like at all. It hurts your head if you wear them longer than 10 minutes. Not pleasant.

author: Nicholas Paul
title: Specific Use Case
content:
If you are an upright runner with very little lateral motion who doesn't like to wear a hat or sunglasses while listening to music...these headphones are perfect!

Everything else, forget it. Riding a bike with a helmet is a pain, even more so when you add sunglasses. The temple point gets in the way.

I bought these for commuting...as soon as I look up, the connecting loop hits my backpack, knocks the buds off my temples...now I'm listening to music I could with my phone on speaker. A waste of time and money...I returned them.

author: Reverend_Dyslow
title: Cheap junk...  DO NOT BUY
content: ZERO stars on ALL FRONTS.  These crappy things do NOT stay connected (and my phone is brand new).  Its IMPOSSIBLE to enjoy ANYTHING when the brand new headphones you just bought are PURE GARBAGE.  BUYER BEWARE

author: Dano
title: Can skip forward but not rewind
content:
I was skeptical about over the ear headphones, but decided to give them a try after reading good reviews from other runners. I run and strength train and enjoy listening to music w ear buds. There are times when i have taken out one bud to listen to  outdoor sounds and my breathing when running so i thought it would be nice to have headphones that gave me both. Upon receiving these I was not expecting much but, I did like the sound they produced considering their structure. Beware, if ur expecting the in ear, bud noise cancelling sound, u will be disappointed. These are what they say they are, the ability to hear some music and answer calls while also hearing noises around you.
For this they do deliver.
There are a pair of foam ear plugs included, you can plug your ears and this amplify the sound slightly by cancelling some of the outside noise.
You can push the multi-function button twice to play the next song, but you are not able to replay the previous song, which i found to be a Miss. I really enjoy replaying my favs, over and over and find the lack of this function to be a  deal breaker. Also, as another reviewer stated, the arms around the back of the neck are long and hang down, having adjustable arms would've been a nice feature.

UPDATE: The non-adjustable arms and a key feature,FOR ME, the inability to reply a previous song was enough to return this item.

author: Kelly ross
title: Great for outdoor use
content: This is the second set of these headphones that I have had, they work great even on airplanes. The only drawback is that if the room is very loud it can be hard to hear people on phone calls unless you put in ear plugs (which works VERY well)

author: Maggie
title: The best
content: I love these headphones. Not as much volume gets in your open ears as you'd think, but it's still possibe to hear your surroundings. I have used these now on shorter runs, just while sitting still, and on a half marathon, and the only thing I didn't love them for was when I was sitting still (didn't love the constant buzzing feeling on my skull). I will certainly continue loving them for running! I was able to forget they were there (usually with in ear headphones, the buds get sweaty and I have to constantly push them back in).

author: ERay
title: I would get them again and works great!!
content: Good product my sons friend has some and loves them.  I can’t stand something inside my ear all day long so thought these might be perfect for times I need them and they are great.  When the volume is super high I do get a bit of a tickle vibrating but not anything bad.  I use them mostly when I help my son mow lawns or I’m listening to a book that everyone in my household doesn’t want to listen to as well.  I would get again good product.  Charge keeps for a good period of time and no annoying cord.

author: Nnanelle
title: Safer while walking
content: I like listening to podcasts and music while walking, but when wearing earbuds it's scary that I can't hear my surroundings. I did a bit of research and decided to give these a try because they seemed comfortable and wouldn't break the bank. Overall they are perfect for what I need. Yes, when I'm on a busy road I have a hard time hearing the music/podcast, but at least I feel safer. I usually have an issue with earbuds or headphones in that after I've worn them for a bit (30 min or more) I'll start to get uncomfortable. With these I can feel them, but there's no pain or discomfort. I like how they can take a bit of sweat or rain (and where I live there's a lot of rain).

author: Mjr
title: Amazing
content: The sound quality is great and the battery life is pretty amazing. You can easily carry on a conversation with the music on and not have to lower the volume. So much better than having something to stick in your ears or to cover them completely and not hear a thing.

author: Rachel
title: Horrible product! Barely 2 months of usage and dead! Waste of time and money!
content: Horrible product, do not waste your money or time! I wish I had returned them, but now I cannot. I kept trying them and thinking they would grow on me....and now they are dead. They will charge, but they will NOT turn on and play with being plugged into the charger. Once they are unplugged from the charger....they are dead as a door nail. I barely got 2 months of use out of them. Barely. Total waste of time and money...and I need earphones to run with!!! Ugh.

author: Levi Towns
title: I would buy again.
content: After a couple weeks if use I've noticed a few things about this product. Firstly I've gotten the battery to last 8 hours and I like the sound quality. Second is that as I move my head around there is a tendency for the speakers to move closer to my ear making the sound more muffled. Lastly that after 10 hours of use the compression on the back of my glasses begins to be uncomfortable on the back and top of my ears.

author: Daniel Weitz
title: Seriously, send your personal data to Libya?
content:
There are two problems with this headset:
1) You cannot adjust them on your head; one size does not comfortable fit all.
2) Send your personal data to LIBYA for the warranty?  You have got to be kidding.

author: Deidre Nelson
title: Good Quality, Gift For Husband=He Loves!
content: Bought these for my husband after he saw a friend at the gym with them on. He likes that they don’t go IN your ear. He’s ran with them on & said they worked well. Only dislike is that your ear kinda “tickles” from the vibration at louder levels of volume. Could be just him though.

author: Christopher Brady
title: Excellent for almost everything
content:
Battery lasts 7+ hours every time.  I use mine all day long,  every single day.  Yes.  Everyday.
I have had them for 1.5+ years.  I have used them all over the world.  I won't travel with out them!  I actually carry a second pair in case I end up somewhere where I don't have power (EMERGENCY BACKUP!)

I work out every day with them and have no issues due to sweat or water.

author: En One
title: Great for hearing the world with stereo, above your ears might get crowded, small power button
content: I had the previous version that was wired and liked it. Not that I have the Bluetooth version it much easier to use. Pros are that it allows you to hear stereo without cutting you off from the world. Running, biking, hiking... all much safer and enjoy able. Cons are that the area over your ears can get pretty crowded with these headphones, plus sunglasses, plus a helmet or hat. The power button is tiny and a pain to find/use they should have had the pause/play button double as the power button instead. Short press pause/play; long hold power.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great!
content: I absolutely love these. I bought these for when I'm riding my bike so that I could hear traffic around me or rattle snakes in the area that I ride in. They are extremely comfortable. The battery life is great in my opinion. I played music that was streamed through my phone on them while at work and nobody could tell that I had them on because the sound was low enough that nobody could hear. The battery lasted about 8 hours on a full charge and running continuously. I sometimes even wear them in boring meetings to listen to music and nobody is any the wiser!

author: Stephanie Marks
title: Really bad sound leakage
content: The headphones fit well and look fine but leak sound like crazy. When wearing them, even with the sound down low others can hear every note and word of the song crystal clear. Would be fine in a situation where it doesn’t matter but not good for any public situation.

author: Russ
title: Noisy environment headphones, can even be worn with hearing protection
content: If you want to listen to music or listen to anything in loud environments, these are what you want! You can wear hearing protection and still hear everything clearly. They work great in any environment really. Another great perk is the battery life is way longer than what is advertised. I use these everyday and have been very impressed with the quality. I'm not very impressed about the calling feature being the same button as the play/pause button, sorry again to anyone I accidentally called. I've gotten use to it and sometimes disable the calling feature in the  Bluetooth settings. These headphones are not as clear of sound quality as good ear buds or headphones, but in the right environment the sound quality is excellent.

author: Ujku Plak
title: They hurt.
content: I hate them. They hurt my ears so bad, but can't find another brand.

author: marcus evans
title: These are pretty cool!
content: I purchased these to wear while running, primarily.  I love that they don't go inside of your ear canal...so you can still be present with your surroundings.  However, the sound quality is great...so you can focus on what is coming thru the headphones, as well.  The "bone conductions technology" is interesting.  it makes your face vibrate (and gives me a 'chill' if I turn the volume up to high - sends a shiver down my spine).  The vibrations seem to give you the perception that you are hearing low frequencies when you are actually feeling them.  These things are interesting.

author: Greg
title: Not good with Garmin 645 Music
content: My second pair. Overall, I like them.  But neither pair works well with my Garmin 645 Music.  If I run with hands low, like normal,  the music breaks up badly.  It forces me to run with high hands.  I have some cheap Craze Bluetooth headphones and never have this issue. Trekz standard solution for everything is manual reset and that's no help.

author: Shellback
title: Accept a new normal, and you'll love these
content:
I am a couple months in on these head phones.  I am an avid mountain biker so I needed something that had good sound, stayed in place and still allowed me to have situational awareness ( mountain lions, bears, and rattle snakes  oh my!!)  I'll give my review by addressing other peoples concerns.

Some people don't like that they move around on your head.  It is true that as you move your head, they do pivot at the speakers.  This took me a few days to get used to but I don't even notice anymore.  The speaker part stays in place in front of your ear while the back moves up and down as your head moves.  While mountain biking they pivot as needed but stay firmly on my head.

Some people have said the sound quality isn't great.  This is true if you are an audiophile with $20k worth of high end sound equipment at home.  For us normal people, the sound quality is very good.  I can clearly hear the music even when I am shooting down a steep rock garden, adrenaline pumping, praying I don't crash.

Other pro's:
- Battery life is good
- Very comfortable
- They fit well while I am wearing my bike helmet and safety glasses.

Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.  I understand that these types of headphones are not for everyone, but for me and my active lifestyle, they have been outstanding, and if you can accept a new normal when wearing headphones, I think you will love (or at least like) them too.

author: Chuck Phill
title: Finaly Found my Gym Headphones
content: These work great are sturdy and stay on while doing High intensity training, Strongman Weightlifting or even hanging upside down. These are the first headphones that have stayed in place through out all my workouts. they also do not obstruct the ear canal which makes communication to a coach or gym buddy easy and helps facilitate a safer environment

author: DynamicFly
title: Great headset, the Airs are much better
content: I ordered these because a friend owned them and loved them. I really like that I can still hear outside sounds as it is safer when I am walking, running, and riding.  However, this model hurt my ears after wearing for a while, especially with sunglasses on.  I returned them and bought the Air model and they are 10x better for fit and comfort!

author: Pedro N. Oliveira Vieira
title: Good for certain tasks
content:
I gave these headphones a four star review based on what these headphones are good at:
1. Earpieces don't stay in my ear so this obviously bypasses that problem
2. For ridding, the open ear nature of these headphones is great because I can still take input from the outside world for safety
3. For running, my ears can "breath" and it's a much more comfortable feeling

What they are not good at is:
1. Canceling noise, if your environment is noisy, in my experience I have difficulty hearing the music (includes air rushing by your ears when ridding)
2. Sound quality is mediocre
3. When the volume is turned up high, it vibrates against my bones which is uncomfortable.

I did decide to keep the headphones and would recommend them with the above mentioned issues. Hope that was helpful!

author: Lregister
title: Excellent sound! Easy to use
content:
I just got them a couple of days ago. I charged the set yesterday and tried it out last night.
The instructions are straightforward and easy to follow. Sound is great; there’s nothing in the ears which is nice. They’re relatively invisible, not that that was a selling point.
I’ll get used to installing them on my ears and the weirdness of the hard plastic on my neck :)  I’m glad I got ‘em

author: juan cossio
title: Despues de un año
content: después de un año de uso uno de los auriculares dejo de funcionar realmente son muy buenos pero hasta hace unas semanas ya no escucho si no por un lado esperaba que duraran mucho mas que solo un año.

author: JvJ
title: Context-sensitive controls are terrible
content:
This headset's controls are context-sensitive.  That means that the functions of the 3 buttons change depending on what you're doing (i.e. listening to music, taking a call, etc.).  However, it's not very good at telling what's going on.

For example, the microphone mute is activated by pressing the + and - buttons at the same time.  But if your headphones decide that you are listening to music instead of in a call, it won't mute.

Also, the microphone un-mutes itself after about 30 seconds for no apparent reason.  I can't find out why that is from manuals or FAQ's.  One of the main reasons I picked this particular headset is that it seemed to have good in-call controls.  But it doesn't.  I'm sending it back.

author: paco
title: Customer service is incomparable
content: Liked it so much i've promoted it to other people.  That said, the manual, which is obtainable, should come with the unit instead of making the customer download it.  The unit is still 5-star in my judgement.

author: Vectre
title: Life changing Headphones
content:
I bought this product for a friend who is deaf in one ear. This device allowed her to be able to hear music from connected devices on both sides of her head for the first time in her life.

The device is fairly simple to connect to any device that has Bluetooth, including your cellphone for calling purposes.

My largest complaint is the universal fit of the headphones may be difficult for some head shapes to seat comfortably. They will still play excellent sound quality, but not be seated as you want them to be.

author: Tony H
title: Would be 5 stars if I didn’t wear glasses
content:
Takes some getting used to, after a lifetime of having headphones and ear buds, listening devises that don’t cover ears. Sound is clear and you can still hold conversations without adjusting an earpiece.
My only knock is they don’t fit the greatest when wearing glasses.

,

author: Nick Rondinella
title: These are a win!
content: Great product! Overall I love these the only shortfall, if any, is when there is a lot of background noise, because of the design of not inserting into the ear, the sound can be drowned out. Otherwise awesome! I like that I can jam my favorite tunes yet still be aware of my surroundings. I, like so many, didn’t read the instructions thoroughly but was able to find the “battery status” due to the ease of use with these. As long as you turn thrm off after use the battery life is really good, worth atleast two weeks of gym use. What I really appreciated about these is that when running or vigorous movement they don’t slide off of your ears or even need adjustment even when your sweating! Great product! Winner winner chicken dinner!

author: Paul
title: Great product
content: Excellent for outdoor running. You really do hear everything. Oddly enough they a bit distracting in a gym where they are playing music because you hear both your own music and whatever house music is on. I’m a frequent traveler and will say that ear plugs are mandatory if you want to use these on a plane ride. Still a great piece of gear that functions exactly as advertised for the function that I wanted. Only reason not a 5 star review is the lack of versatility.

author: Copilaut
title: AfterShokz Are Off The Charts
content: Bought these for the wife. She’s a runner, and really likes them. She pairs them up with her phone. The only downside is that when she’s doing a serious training run or race, she doesn’t want to be bothered taking her phone, so she can’t use these. I mainly wanted her to have these for safety, as she can hear her surroundings as she’s running as listening to music. In that respect, they have done the job well.

author: MW
title: Great headphones. Wife can finally yell for me (and I can hear her) when I am working out.
content:
For riding a bike outside, I agree the wind can cause sound issues. However, if you position the headset right, you can get good sound while riding. Not good with lawn equipment, period. The sound quality is good when you put them on a spot near your ear opening.

These headphones are great for normal wearing around the house, backyard, etc. My biggest peeve with other headphone & earbuds was the sweat pooling in my ear when I worked out. AfterShokz hasn't given me that issue.

The other reviews citing odd vibrations at high volumes are accurate. Don't turn them up that far & there is no problem.

I can still hear everything around me when the volume is lower. When it's at mid-level, it's nearly the same as having one earphone in and the other not.

*Fun Tidbit* - Stick the headphones on the rear sides of your head. That's a neat experience. You really can hear the music that far from your ears. I did that tonight, June 13, 2019, just playing around with them. Volume was mid-level when I did it.

Oh, the reflectors are a neat addition. Haven't put them on anything yet. I'll add some to the earphones & maybe my son's bike & mine.

author: CheriM
title: I wish it were adjustable!
content: I love the sound quality, the feel of the materials, and the overall look of the device, however the fit isn't quite right. Two majorly annoying things: it pinches around the top of my ears no matter how I position it, and the band is far too large for my head. I don't have a particularly small head, either. Most hats I HAVE to get adjustable, and then it's adjusted almost the biggest it can get, and with this band, it's still too big. I can put my entire hand underneath the band and the back of my head. While I'm sure having it a little loose allows for movement (and hair), having it this loose on me, means if I look upwards, even a little bit, the band hits the top of my shoulders/base of my neck and gets pushed slightly out of position. If the band were shorter, it would be further up my neck and not have this problem. 😩 I'm afraid these may get inherited by my son and I go back to the drawing board for lightweight and space-saving headphones that I don't have to stick in my ear canal. (I have chronic eczema in my ears). You also cannot wear sunglasses or eyeglasses with these. They compete for space above your ear and quickly become uncomfortable. I have figured out the most comfortable way to wear these for me is to wear a very low, loose ponytail and let the band sit just above it, resting on my ponytail. That's they only way I can wear them without hurting my ears after a while.

author: M & J Rey
title: Very good but for limited uses
content: I got these specifically for cycling so I could listen to things while riding and still hear road noises.  In that use they work very well but they have some limitations that you have to accept.  One thing I found is they don't work very well in the winter when wearing a headband/ear-warmer. I tried them over the ear-warmer and the sound is poor and you can't really put the ear-warmer over the headphone because of the loop behind your head.

author: Eriktherev
title: Great sound and allows you to hear what's around you
content:
I have had these now for over a week and am glad that I chose to go this route.  They are wonderful and have great sound quality.  It took some getting used to as I have only had in the ear headphones before.  However, now I wouldn't go back.  They allow me tonhalear things while I am walking around the neighborhood at night, so there are no surprises.
I look forward to using these for a long time to come.

author: Robert
title: Excellent Product
content: For me the major benefit of these headphones is that they are not worn within the ear and not noise cancelling as I use them when I walk outside.  They have very good sound quality that also allows me to hear outside noises.

author: lawrence clare
title: Great for listening and hearing whats going on around you also 4 people with hearing loss
content: sound is great I especially like the fact you can listen to tv or music and still hear things around you like cars telephone .my wife has hearing loss and uses them to listen to tv in bed and I cant hear them . before she would have the tv so loud I would have to remind her to turn it down , and I could hear the regular headphones when she used them . only negative is they take a while to charge but they last around  8 hours . they remind you when they need charging .

author: Robot Shopper
title: Not comfortable or secure for serious runners
content: I'm an avid runner. I did not find these comfortable or secure. They slip out of place quite a bit when sweating. If you lay down with them on (say, on a bench press or to do sit ups) they will get pushed out of place. Sound quality is adequate. Not bad if you're not working out in them daily. I've also started noticing the sound cutting out here and there so my pair may be going bad (I've had them for ~4 months). Also, when the volume is up, you can barely hear your surroundings anyway, so why even bother with "bone conduction?"

author: Amazon Customer
title: Very impressive!
content: Easy to connect, easy to use and sound quality is better than expected. My work conditions require I wear earplugs and these are a perfect fit for that environment. Highly recommend these!

author: C. Raum
title: Excellent product, fantastic support and service
content:
I've owned three of these over the last ~four years. I use them in a lab where for safety reasons you can't use headphones. When you use earplugs in conjunction with the headphones you get the same noise isolation that you get with silicone ear buds and the quality of sound is comparable with typical ear buds. With out earplugs you loose some fidelity, but have the benefit of hearing your environment much better.

I've had to return headsets twice. Once because the speakers in the headset started to vibrate and distort sound; and the current set because my lab decided to irrationally cut down on all manner of anything involved with sound and your ears - regardless of the situational awareness maintenance that the bone conduction headphones allow. In both cases AfterShokz was extremely responsive and handled both the malfunctioning headset and return headset quickly and fairly.

TLR: Excellent product, fantastic service. You can't go wrong, esp where situational awareness is important.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Long battery life so far.
content: Get product. Battery seems to last a long time even longer than description. Get if you want to hear what’s going on around you. Not much bass so if you are looking for high quality sound look else where but if you just want some tunes, and still hear everything going on around you this is for you. This does exactly as described and is perfect for my needs. I am very happy.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Best Wireless Headset
content: I have tried a variety of headsets and never written a review.  I will make an exception as I have used my Trekz in the last week more than I have used any headset that I have owned.  It is light weight and can sit around your neck to use if a call comes in.  It is low profile and doesn't stick out like Frankenstein nodes.  Easy to pair with both phone and laptop easily and switches nicely between the two.  Sound quality is excellent and I am told that the microphone is clear and comes in strong.  The only negative I have notices is if I have it on for a few hours it is tight below the temples but not sure it would work well if it wasn't.....Best I have used.

author: Denise L Notman
title: Buttons places to scratch ears.
content: After wearing for a couple weeks (8hour days) for work, need to find a different style.  These rest so the buttons scratch the back of the ear and the sores are getting too much.  I keep lifting the set up so it doesn't put pressure on the ears but gravity works to pull them back down.

author: JSL
title: Nice for running
content: These seem more like small audio speakers than induction devices. They're comfortable to wear for the most part, but there are no adjustments to be made, so at times they press a little too hard on my jaw joint. But I do like the safety aspect of being able to hear what's going on around me as I run.

author: TinBat
title: Very comfortable and a must if you are a walker and/or runner.
content: Great fit and battery life. Paired easily with my phone. Easy to operate. Sound is good. Great to hear ambient noises like cars and people around you if you are a walker/runner...so much safer! One thing to consider is when turning off it is a little difficult to hear the music prompt that the earphones are shutting down.

author: Terig
title: I have tinnitus and I love that I can listen without earbuds in my ear
content: I am so happy I purchased my Trekz.  I have Tinnitus mostly in my right ear and cannot listen to regular headphones. It makes the ringing so much worse.  These are amazing.  I can listen to podcasts or music and the sound is so good.  I also like that I can hear around me if I'm outside but can use the earplugs if I want to block out other noise.  Even without the earplugs I can hear the music or podcasts fine with no interference.  One of my best purchases

author: Jon S.
title: My After-Shokz work great
content: I wear CIC hearing aids and now with the After-Shokz headphones I don't have to remove them to place earbuds in my ears. The sound quality is terrific and I can hear if anybody is talking to me.

author: Jeffrey L.
title: Good product, not great
content: This is a good product for listening to background music, or for a conference call while still being able to hear what's going on around you. However, I am surprised that someone can hear the sound if they stand beside you. I thought it would be inaudible to others. That's what's most disappointing. The sound quality will not impress an audiophile but is adequate for it's purpose.

author: mike
title: Not What I Hoped for
content: I had a good feeling purchasing these, but after 1 month of using them while working (outdoor work in the heat, & sweating alot) I had people I was talking to while using this product complain to me that they could hear everything but me.  Crackling noises, cutting out, not getting clear voice for them to hear me.  I believe this product could use some more tweeking when it come to the sound quality and noise cancellation and mostly the moisture wicking.  I'm sad and disappointed because I had high hopes.

author: James
title: Great for the gym
content:
Let's get the negative out of the way first.  The only reason I didn't give these headphones 5 stars is the lack of bass.  Not a deal breaker for me but would have been nice.

Now for the good stuff!  I was skeptical at first because I've never tried bone conduction headphones before but these are super-comfortable and sound quality is nice and crisp.  Great for audiobooks.  I bought these primarily to wear at the gym so when I put them to the test I was impressed...even during strenuous weight lifting and lot of sweating they stayed securely fitted.  Also my gym has horrible "mainstream" music (if you can even call it music) blasting across the whole place and I was afraid with these headphones being off-ear that might be a problem but thankfully I couldn't hear it hardly at all.

author: LWBeck
title: Fabulous!
content: These are excellent head phones.  My son is deaf in one ear, yet he can hear fairly well through these bone conduction headphones on his deaf side, as opposed to hearing nothing.  He was ecstatic, as am I.  He liked them so much that I ordered them for myself.  They're awesome!

author: Verigam
title: FRAUD!  Buyer Beware
content: These are definitely NOT using bone to transmit sound, they are nothing more than speakers next to the ear.  I still have my old Bone Phone's from decades ago and they emit NO audible sound.  These units are over priced over the ear buds and should not be advertised this way.  NOT RECOMMENDED

author: Ladybug
title: Stylish and cool, just a minor problem with the weight issue.
content: I like ending on a positive note, so I'll just say that these headphones after being worn for about a couple of hours, hurts the ears. They rest behind The ears. I think they are applying too much downward pressure. I fix this problem by placing them over the arms of my safety glasses at work. That seems to give some relief for a couple of hours. The microphone is ok...it's good if you need to take a call hands-free and you aren't worried about the quality. I find I have to turn up the volume on my phone a bit to understand the person on the other end, then the headphones vibrate like crazy, distorting the caller's voice. It feels very weird to have my face vibrating! The microphone makes it sound like I'm in a tin can, but it works. I give an over-all rating of 4 stars because of the heaviness upon my ears. I love love love the ability to listen to my favorite music at work and still be able to interact with the world around me. That is too cool. The sound is nice. If you are looking for a full bass sound, these will not provide that, but they do offer the ability to listen to music safely on the go.

author: Austin
title: Great once you get used to it.
content: First pair of bone conduction headphones. I use these exclusivley at work where I have hearing protection in a noisy shop environment. There is a noticeable difference in sound quality compared to a good set of cans or in ears and they do lacm somewhat in the bass but I am more than happy to take thay trade off and protect my hearing. They have an EQ setting specificaly for use with hear-pro which works quite well. My only issue is they dont always seat properly and the usablity will depend greatly on the shape of your head.

author: Bobby
title: perfect if you don't like ear plugs in your ear for hours
content: sound is great without plugs, you will hear surrounding noise. plugs in ears cancels all noise. but... that's what plugs do anyway.  DOWNSIDE... I wish the volume adjustment piece which is on the right ear, same construct on left-hurts my ears. Its too close and sits right behind the ear. Should be further to the back.

author: Saurabh Patel
title: Stopped working after 4 months
content: Loved the sound quality and the headphones until they stopped working a few months after I purchased them. Won’t pair with my phone anymore. To spend $100 on headphones and have them stop working shortly after sucks. Microphone didn’t work great either. No support available so they don’t warranty their products either. I’m guessing most of these 5 star reviews are fake.

author: SueLB
title: Exceptional & best headphones
content: Amazing headphones!  I wear hearing aids & now don’t have multiple buds in my ears when I want to listen to music or news.  Fantastic sounds & worth the money!

author: Dennis
title: Cool headphones!
content:
Pros: Bone conducting allows the user to remain aware of your surroundings while listening to your favorite music, podcast, etc... Two EQ settings, one for music and the other voice. Battery life is great, charge lasts over 6 hours of continuous use

Cons: fits a little big, if I had know that they had a mini version, I would have gotten that one. Two EQ settings, which it had more.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great headphones for enviorments you need to hear your surroundings!
content: These headphones are a daily use item for me, I use them for 8 and a half hours Monday-Friday for work, they hold a charge all day, the sound quality isn't the best by any means but they sound amazing for also being able to hear all noises around you!

author: Michael F. Hammell
title: Interesting and convenient form fit
content: I like the form, ease of use, and quality of sound.  The ability to carry on a brief conversation while using the headphones is very impressive.  I also appreciate that I can hear sounds that someone sitting close to me cannot.  I like that the charging is simple and efficient.

author: I AM THE NIGHT, I AM THE EVIL, I AM FAT-MAN
title: Great headphone that doesn’t last a year.
content:
It’s been about two months but loving it!
Works great in class during college, cycling, and many more!

The problem is that sometimes the music and sounds skips around a bit by bit. It’s not quite clear when using the microphone, been told couple of times that they couldn’t hear me through the microphone.

Too bad this product only useable for 6hrs. Would’ve been better if it was 10 to 12 hrs like the power beats.

UPDATE: I bought this product on January and the arm part snaps in November. Also the bluetooth lags a lot. The music skips a bit and sometimes it’s difficult to talk through the mic. Going to have to reduce one star from this product because it did not last a year or two. Was expecting to last at least a year.

author: matthewpartrick
title: Excellent sound
content: One of the best sound-wise for bone condutions I've used.  Is water resistant and good for sweaty runs, but not waterproof so don't swim with them.  Plus since they don't sit in your ears you can safely run with them and hear ambient noise cars etc.  Highly recommended.

author: Michelle
title: Horribly uncomfortable
content: I sized them per the aftershoz website the fit. But are very uncomfortable to wear for more than 2 hours. The sound quality is ok but for the price it should be better. I’ve bought Walmart cheap Bluetooth headphones that sound better. Over all I wouldn’t buy again or suggest anyone buy them.

author: Ethan
title: Title is really mis leading!
content: This product DOES NOT work as it says it should. It was really disappointing because I thought that there would be no sound and the bone conduction would do it all. These head phones are just ear buds with a base. Sound quality is super bad. I wore the head phones the way they suggested but the sound quality was super bad and I could barely hear it. Then I moved the speakers into my ear lobes and the sound was better but at that point I realized these are not State of the art technology, these are crap over priced head phones. Very Disappointed... would not recommend.

author: Bam Bam
title: Really nice so far, if a little pricey
content:
I tried these headphones out, after buying a knock-off brand with a similar design (which failed after a few months).

They are really nice! They fit well around the neck, they pair quickly, and the audio is clear. This style of headphone is known for being light on bass, so you may want to pass if you expect that. They are better suited for podcasts and higher-range music.

The price is a little steep, compared to the off-brands... but then again, I'm here because my off-brand headset died an early death.

author: happychemistry
title: Exactly what I was looking for - good running bluetooth headphones
content: I have and android phone and I've tried all sorts of bluetooth earphones/buds and also wired earphones/buds.  I've been left frustrated in the past with the performance of these devices.  They would either come loose and fall out during runs/gym sessions, they would be noise cancelling (which can be dangerous when out for a run or a bike ride), they would lose bluetooth signal (my beats were notorious for this), they just weren't durable (several brands including my beats fell into this category) and if they were wired, the wires would get tangled during use and when stored.  Therefore, when I read about the AfterShokz Trekz Titanium Open-Ear Wireless Bone Conduction Headphones via several running websites/blogs and tech product review websites, I was skeptical about performance and how I would like them.  Yet,  I have to say that they are exactly what I have been searching for.  They are secure (they haven't fallen out during any of my runs), I don't loose bluetooth signal, they are made of rubber and have durable construction, they fold up easy for transport, they don't have wires to get tangled and the sound quality allow for some ambient noise to filter in, but that's what I was actually looking for (safety reasons).  So far, so good!

author: John Nicholson
title: Perfect Bone Conduction Headphone
content: I’ve been rocking with AfterShokz for a few years now. Call it brand loyalty, but these headphones are vital to my daily experiences. Being able to have a soundtrack to my life events while still having audible access to my surroundings is enthralling! These promote safety while navigating environments. I use these when I run, cycle, and strength train in the gym. When I have an incoming call, a quick press and I’m plugged in. The range is about 20-30 feet. Haven’t had any connectivity issues. You will experience some leakage with music if you crank the volume to the max but phone calls not so much. Pairing is easy. The warranty is excellent! Very compatible with Siri. Skips tracks. Pauses tracks. Allows call waiting switch. It’s a worthy investment overall. Haven’t had anything else other than AfterShokz. None of the knock-offs measure up even at the fraction of the cost.

author: Rtr
title: Make Sure You size them - Consider Mini
content: I love the concept of bone conduction. It allows to hear the ambient sound around you if you wish. The only complaint is that the regular size is quite large for the average head  MAKE SURE YOU USE THE SIZING PAPER YOU CAN PRINT OUT TO CONFIRM THE CORRECT SIZE.

author: Red robin
title: On a low setting you can hear what's playing as well as outside sounds.
content: I like how secure they fit ear area but are loose on the back of head.  I have to prop it up on a towel or my ponytail to keep it set where I need it.  The sound quality is good and does a fine job of canceling other noises without the earplugs they provide.  My boyfriend like them so much he bought a pair for himself.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Nice product. Take care of them properly.
content:
This is my third set of Trex Titanium headsets. They have excellent sound quality without blocking the ear canal. Thus you can hear ambient noise easily. If you want noise canceling, simply use earplugs-(provided).  The controls are easy to learn and use.
The down side is that they must be handled carefully. My first pair was replaced under warranty when they broke when putting them on. I broke the second set when carrying them in my cargo pocket of my shorts- bad move. When I bought this pair I also purchased the safety carry case. The best way to travel with them is on your head- even when not using them. Aside from that use the carry case.

author: Teresa A. Lively-Hall
title: Less than a year
content:
I purchased these in November 2018, they almost made it to a year before one side snapped. The most I'd ever done with these was put them on so needless to say I'm not really happy with the quality, though otherwise they were fine while they lasted.
Lot of money to spend for less than a years worth of use.

title: Ok for some situations
content:
Overall, they are ok. I like the comfort, weight, and size of them. The battery life is sufficient.

My biggest issue is the maximum volume output. I took these headphones on a flight and could barely hear the audio over the hum of the engines. I know part of the benefit is the ability to hear the environment around you while wearing them, but I'd also like to be able to hear the headphones.

author: ROYALTY
title: Really good.
content: I was skeptical when I saw this product on QVC, but I decided to check it out. It’s amazing. Soft sound, high quality, good package, easy to use.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great for calls and keeping ears open!  Weak for music.
content: Great for phone calls and keeping your ears open.  Slight pressure fatigue on the sides of head.  Music is functional but you will definitely want to use your favorite EQ app tweak the sound as out of the box it's pretty disappointing.  For bone conductive/keeping ears open they are great but will be outperformed in music by $20 earbuds and pretty much everything over ear.  Build quality is solid.  Very unique product.

author: Roger Jimenez
title: Great product
content: My kiddo loves these. She’s autistic and does need the big headphones to cover hears. These do the job. She loves the sound and for of them. Works even better with earplugs

author: Patrick A. Patterson
title: These are GREAT
content: Best headphones I've ever used.  Excellent battery life, wonderful call and music clarity, impervious to sweat and you can hear what is going on around you.  I no longer fear traffic coming up on me from the rear or the attacking dog from the rear.  Conversations with other people while using these are possible.  You no longer have to pop out an earbud to hear someone talking to you.  Can even be used in the automobile because your normal hearing is not interfered with.  I highly recommend these to my family.  My several other sets of ear buds are now in the trash.

author: Kerry Brunson
title: Cool concept
content: As of the writing of this review I have had this headset about two months. It's a cool concept, but if you're going to be somewhere noisy, like a fitness center, you definitely need the little foam ear plugs to hear things better. If I turn the volume up too high, the little hairs at my temple vibrate and tickle my skin. Still trying to figure out a happy medium.

author: Jamie O.
title: Awesome headphones! Get them!
content: I enjoy running. I’ve never found earphones that didn’t constantly fall out if my ears or that felt comfortable. That is untik now. These headphones have made running a joy again! While the quality of the music is not as good as traditional headphones, in my opinion the sound is very good considering the way the sound is transmitted. I love these and would highly recommend them to anyone who enjoys being active but wants to enjoy music at the same time!

author: Inquiring  customer
title: Very disappointed in the size
content: These would be comfortable but much to big. The sound is excellent and I can still hear other sounds which would make them ideal for safely walking. They are just too large around my head.

author: Christopher Baker
title: Blah don’t waste your money
content: It’s basically a speaker on your face that vibrates, the vibration isn’t  necessary at all, I took mine apart and removed the rumbler and it makes them more comfortable to wear with no difference in sound quality.

author: Michael Hennessy
title: Exactly what I wanted!
content: This is just perfect for running! I had the ear buds before which "mostly" stayed in my ears...but I had to pretty consistently push them back in to ensure they didn't drop out. With these, I don't even have to think about it...which was my goal. The sound is great, they don't move on my head and it just works.

author: A Guy From Texas
title: Great fit and sound
content:
I was a little skeptical about buying these because they are so unusual for headphones, but I decided to take a chance based on reviews that I read here and other running forums. I'm really glad that I did. I've been on two runs so far, and I'm amazed how well these things work. The sound is more than good enough for jogging. I am able to clearly hear my music with the volume at less than maximum, and I can also hear what's going on in my surroundings well enough. I'm generally aware when cars are nearby, and can hear if someone speaks loudly to me. As others have said, these are not the right headphones if you are looking for perfect audio quality and deep bass. They are made for those who need good sound quality and environment awareness.

The fit is fantastic. They are comfortable and don't move or bounce at all while I am jogging. I have worn them while jogging with sunglasses and it wasn't a problem at all.

The controls work well and seem sturdy. They use a standard micro USB charging port, which is easy enough to use and seems securely attached.

I use mine with a Garmin Vivoactive 3 Music smart watch, which allows me to download music to my watch and play music on the Aftershokz. It's the perfect combination for running at a very reasonable price.

author: Scott Alan Johnson
title: Best headphones for open ear awareness
content:
You must know what you’re after with these headphones. Sound quality is fine. It’s not great, but if you want great sound, you’re going to buy Bose or Beats or something along those lines.

These are great headphones for people who want open ears, ease of use, and lengthy battery life. I wear these things all day sometimes and only once have I ever even approached the battery limit. You can listen to music or podcasts on a run without the danger of isolating yourself from the world around you.

Drawbacks: they take some working to use while wearing hats of any kind. Probably going to be even harder to use in bitterly cold weather when I want to cover my whole head. Ditto for reclining in a chair and resting your head while listening to music. They just don’t fit on your head for that sort of thing. But this is such a minor problem for me that I’d still give a very good rating.

author: JGaz
title: Great bluetooth headphones with a long battery life
content:
Been using these for cycling and for various events and can say they work great. I am able to hear outside noises and listen to music which is very important while road biking around traffic. When I first got them I decided to test out the battery life after full charge. They lasted for about 9 1/2 hours of just playing music, so that was a major plus. Good quality sound for everyday music play as well as using the phone.

I only have 2 issues with this headset. One would be the neck piece which is a bit long, wish they made it adjustable, or buy the mini version. With the neck piece being as long as it is, when you lay down, rest your head or look up, in my case cycling, it tends to move around the front of your ears, which in turn changes the sound of music but still not a deal breaker.  My next issues would be that after long periods of music listening, around about 5 to 6 hours, they tend to start aching the front of your ears, but I figure any headset, in ear or out, is gonna start aching after very long periods with no breaks.

Overall, good quality sound with a long battery life.  Great for doing activities in which you still need to hear what is going on outside. Would recommend these for sports enthusiast.

author: michael r adams
title: Great products fast service great prices thank you
content: These are absolutely fantastic you can take calls I mean you can do everything with you so you can listen to your music I mean you can be on your computer I am in these are the best thing I can ever came out my husband and I need someone else saw him with him and she wants him to so he just got right into Amazon and sent right away for them and she loves them she’s never without I hope you take that as a complement as it was meant to be and she never has them off and actually they were the wrong people that we did water but she doesn’t know that and they’re just higher grade so I mean she lives them just the same He’s very thankful for them she’s not very tech smart but she’s very nice lady and older lady she’s very happy to get her headphones thank you Amazon again

author: SRS
title: Best on market
content: Wife got me another brand that  didn't cancel anything. Sent back and got these. Best ever at full volume (Almost too loud to listen to)  People try talking to me and don't even know they're on. I have to pause them to hear what they are saying. At lower levels it's like background music. I'm a mechanic and they stay put and don't get in the way even  Lying down on a creeper. I give them to my 8 year old daughter while driving she loves them also and the backseat is nice and quiet on road trips.  Highly recommend for everyone

author: Mz. Magoo
title: Excellent quality.  Very comfortable.
content: I rate these 3 stars on noise cancelling because they're pass-through headphones. They're clear and the quality is excellent. Comfortable for all day wear - even with my glasses on. I don't have to remove them  to answer the phone at work and can hear when people are behind me in the office.

author: D. R. Folkerts
title: These are amazing!!
content: We got these for our son for Christmas, and of course we all had to try them.  WOW!  We are definitely sold, and will be looking to get more of these next Christmas for others on our list.  :)

author: Todd Niesen
title: Very tinny and not enjoyable
content: I bought these on advice from a friend of mine who is an athlete and a musician, assuming the sound quality would at least be better than my earbuds that came with my phone.  I thought I'd really enjoy these, but I'm relegating them to listening to podcasts, as the audio for music is awful.  I tried moving them in every position around my ears and with every EQ setting on my iPhone, and they still sound like a transistor radio.  If you like to get inspired as you listen to music as you work out, these are not the headphones for you.

author: J1ELXTRX
title: Bone Conduction Headphones WOW!!!
content: I have 2 Plantronic Backbeat Fit headphones which I love. I've found that because they fit in the ear I'm less aware of my surroundings. That's fine at home but not ideal when running, shopping or driving. I was skeptical that the sound would be clear and still have tactical awareness. I was wrong this is an outstanding product. I listen to podcasts, audiobooks and a wide variety of music... Everything sounds superb.

author: Tim McGrail
title: Good sound and a must for anybody with ear troubles
content: I cannot put anything in my ears while I am working out or I will have ear issues this gem solves my problem. Is it the sound perfect? No but it is definitely good enough for workout music or movies.

author: Chris L.
title: Great all around.
content: I absolutely love these things!  I know they are designed for sports use but I use them in an office and high noise environment. I can listen to music in the office and still hear co-workers if they need anything.  When I'm in high noise areas I can use ear plugs and the sound actually becomes more clear and louder.  I highly recommend these!  Oh, also they have a built in mic that works great too.  Has no problems in high noise areas or in the office. It's worth the price!

author: Roy Mulhall
title: Holds fast, decent sound.
content: My first time getting bone conduction earphones, wasn't sure what to expect. The main reasons I wanted to try these were the fact that they don't go into your ear canals at all.  And the fact that I can still listen to what's going on around me while listening to music. The sound quality is pretty decent and is audible if there isn't TOO much ambient noise around you.  Comfort wise they hold fast even while doing strenuous exercises. Though after a while there is minimal irritation to the sides of your head.  Overall I would recommend this to others who wanna listen to music while not drowning out the environment around them,  very good for people who want to keep their situational awareness up.

author: Alfredo Hernandez
title: Overpriced and still cant hear surroundings
content: I bought these for work and i gotta say they don't really do what it says they do. These are basically mini speakers right next to your ears that allow you to still slightly hear around you at a very low volume. I bought these thinking they'd be better quality which they do feel nice and the sound is actually pretty good but for that you might as well go with regular headphones. Still doesn't really allow me to hear my surroundings. Other than that good pair of headphones.

author: Myles A. Dickerson
title: Definitely worth the money.
content: I had the blue 2S before these. I loved those. These however are even better. Sturdier, louder, clearer, easier to pair & operate. These have a longer battery life than the blue 2S. Definitely recommend these.

author: Jason P
title: Great for work!
content: I work in a loud factory and I need an open ear canal for safety. These are great! I can listen to podcasts and music all day while I work.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fair product for aircraft mechs
content: Fair product. I use this for work. I’m an aircraft mechanic. Won’t be able to hear if there’s a lot going on. But if you have earplugs it works out, but I can see this being a awesome go to for working out or doing other things out.

author: Allyssa Batten
title: Wonderful alternative to over-the-ear headphones and earbuds
content: For people like me who don't find either earbuds or over-the-ear headphones comfortable, these are amazing. And even if you do, I recommend giving these a try. The sound quality is surprisingly good and I haven't had any issue with the sound reaching / disturbing people around me. I've never been in a situation where I've run out of battery, though I charge it after most uses. For the most part I wear them while doing chores or working out so I like that I can still hear around me if someone is trying to speak to me. I also greatly enjoy that these can be completely noise cancelling when pared with ear plugs (perfect when flying to block out the noise of the plane and other passengers).

author: Ari Blum
title: Great with some reservations
content: I absolutely love the function and form, but they have a design flaw (which I've contacted them about).  The portion that attaches the speaker to the rest of the device is a thin plastic which can snap off.  I was disappointed that mine broke, BUT since I like the device so much a purchased another.  They warranty it for 2 years, so it's well worth the money.  The only other down side is that you may need soft ear plugs to eliminate ambient noise, especially at the gym.  It's a minor issue.

author: Jstjen
title: Disappointing
content:
I purchased these to use at the office.  I liked that they did not block my hearing as I need to listen for the phone but work better with music playing.  My office is more open plan so I didn't want to disturb others with my music and this concept was perfect.  WRONG! They don't fit.  They are HUGE!  There is no way to adjust the band to you are stuck with this "universal" size the arbitrarily chose.  There is at least 2" between the band and my neck.  You cannot wear these with glasses.  I know there are people excited about being able to wear them with glasses.  Yeah no, not happening.  The plastic par that sits near the ear is so thick that my glasses are pushed forward and now cause headaches.
This company either needs to come up with multiple sizes or a way to adjust the band.  I will be returning them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Had for awhile, love them still
content:
These are amazing!

I have hearing loss, so these are better for me than regular headphones.

People who skydive/indoor skydive use these in the tunnel a lot. These are awesome. You can wear ear plugs, protecting your ears and still hear the music at low wind speeds.

I personally love these for working out and running around the house.
Unfortunately, they would not pair with my old phone. But they do work on my Pixel 2.

Not lots of bass in the sound quality, mostly treble. The microphone is decent. Good product!

author: Michael Stapleton
title: Great quality & Customer Service
content: This is my 3rd pair.  I bought the first pair and it started to rattle, Trekz honored the warranty no questions asked and sent me a second pair.  I bought this pair for my wife.  I use them all the time.

author: Ginger Evans
title: Only worked 1 month... no customer support
content: I DID LOVE THESE.  Received these July 5th and used them regularly for almost a month and a half  before they started turning off during runs. They would not turn back on without removing them from my head and waiting several minutes.  Any small movement seems to turn them off  at times... almost as if they have a short in them.  Contacted Customer Support through Amazon Orders link who attempted to trouble shoot, but ultimately said I needed to speak with the company’s customer support.  Left a voicemail and have not heard back from them.  They were great when they worked consistently, but the set I received were not worth $80 for a month of use.

author: nicole s. stefko
title: They work great
content:
I love these the sound is
Great the get loud but not too loud you can lay down with them by adjusting them they are comfortable calls
Come in very clear.  The huge plus I can still
Hear what is going on around me and that is my biggest concern I LOVE THESE UPDATE:  These work so well and are amazingly comfortable to sleep in I will be buying another one to have one while the other charges

author: M. R. Haubrich
title: Ideal for running or jogging
content: I don't care for earbuds, because they just don't handle sweaty ears very well.  I found my earbuds loosening or falling out when I run.  I had some over the ear headphones, but they didn't last too long.  I like the afershokz because they don't cover my ears, and they don't get too hot when I am running or exercising.  The sound quality is more than adequate, but I don't demand high quality when I am exercising.  I just need to have some music to motivate me.  I bought this set after misplacing another set, and so I was sure I would be satisfied.

author: rjmeyer67
title: Works flawlessly as advertised.
content:
Everything is almost perfect. I am hearing impaired so I don’t like to cover my ears.
Sound quality is so impressive I find myself taking them off to make sure a Bluetooth speaker isn’t on by mistake.
The design keeps moisture and sweat away from internal electronics. Nicely done.
Phone calls are clear and the microphone sound better than using my iPhone integral microphone, according to my wife.
My only recommendation would be to make the tension adjustable. I have a larger head so I knew the mini was out of the question. Still the full size is a little uncomfortable. It could break in over time so I’m still very satisfied.

author: KentuckyPharmer
title: They serve their purpose but sound quality isn't so good. Consider the MINI version
content: Pay attention to what other reviews say about sound quality problems, they just don't sound as good as any halfway decent earbuds. But, you can hear your surroundings which is what I wanted them for. I use them running, intended to use them biking, and in an office ( I work in a cube). I wanted to listen to my music but not be seen as " tuned out" and ignoring my coworkers; if someone says my name I can hear it, pause my music, and have a conversation. I would have bought the mini version. These have quite a bit too much material around the back of my head. I have an average size head for a 5'11" man.

author: C. Hill
title: Kind of so so....
content: Worked as described for one workout then they would not power up again. Returned. I decided not to repurchase because the wrap around ear was irritating on one side. The sound wasn't excellent... I kept trying to find the sweet spot. If you have long hair and wear it down, the texture of the wrap around grabs your hair a bit. Really cool technology... just not for me.

author: Tia Clark
title: Safety first.
content: This is a great bluetooth headset. It's not made to be noise cancelling or fantastic sound. You wear them right above your ears so you can still hear surrounding sounds around you. Perfect for driving and talking on the phone. Great for running, exercising and still hear traffic or whatever.

author: Jakeymon
title: Really good for outdoor running
content:
I’ve been looking for a decent running headphone solution for years - like since the Sony SPORTS line of the 1990s - and these are the best I’ve found by a long shot. They stay where I put them, they don’t get all gross with ear wax, they don’t hurt, and I can hear cars and bikes and other runners perfectly.

Do they have perfect sound fidelity and awesome bass and sweet treble? No. The sound quality is decent, but not audiophile. But you don’t want audiophile when you’re running outside. You want music and the ability to hear what’s coming behind you. At the same time. That’s what these get you.

I sweat a lot and these things do fine with that.

I’m not sure why Amazon asked me to rate how these are at moisture wicking. They’re headphones.

author: tlfuller
title: Great for what are
content:
No, these will not win any awards for sound quality, but not having your ears covered is great for hearing what's going on around you.
Watch TV while the baby sleeps, go for a jog and hear cars approaching.
The battery life could be a bit longer, that is my only real complaint.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great for my small ear canals.
content:
I have a hard time finding a set of headphones/headset that will fit my ears and this is a great alternative.  I like that it doesn't have to go inside my ears but instead wraps around my head.  Sound quality is quite decent without plugging my ears and is fantastic when I do put in the foam plugs, though for my small ear canals I can't leave them in for long.

battery life is good, I can get a full day of heavy use and a couple days under my typical usage of audio books and Pandora.

author: None Ya
title: Hmm
content:
The sound is god awful. I'm not an audiophile by ANY stretch. I'm reading reviews on here that say they are some of the best they've heard. I can walk down to the dollar store and buy the world's cheapest earbuds that would rival this in sound quality. Everything seriously sounds like movie night at the drive-in through that tiny little 3" paper speaker, it's all mid-range. I'd rather mount that speaker to my bike. I get the appeal, I wanted to be able to hear my surroundings, but there's no way I'm listening to music on them. Talking on them would be fine I'm sure.

Edit: meh they're fine. Hate to be too harsh. Seem like a quality product. Maybe my face is too fat.

author: Barrett
title: Work very well for me.
content: I use these for outdoor walks and running as well as working out at the gym.  They’ve worked very well for me.  Sound quality seems fine and they stay in place much better than any earbuds I’ve ever used.  I also wear eyeglasses with thin wire frames and haven’t had any issues with having both on at the same time.

author: rowan
title: Overpriced but good product
content:
Not a bad concept
 wil probably be executed better in the future however these work for now
it kind of makes the world feel like a soundtrack has been added you still hear all ambient noise as you woulld the only difference is there is music on top of it

author: Ann Powell
title: Great for the paranoid
content: I’m paranoid. I don’t like not being able to hear the word around me. I also love music and podcasts and there in lye my problem. I can’t ware regular earbuds because of the paranoia and I can’t listen to everything were everyone can hear. These fix my problem and work wonderfully! I can run and hear the cars coming, work out and hear the people around me, work at my desk and no one can sneak up on me. They work great for hands free conversation on the phone to. I ware them all day and listen to what ever I want and still hear everything around me. I use them to listen to music while at the shooting range with earplug. It’s take a few days to get adjusted to how they feel on your head, but after that you will have to have them!

author: SirKnight
title: Great sound, but the squeeze your head
content: I try to wear these for work all day but I can not. It is 3:30 right now and the side of my head are in pain. The headphones put alot of pressure on the sides of you head so you can not wear them for a long time. I have had them for about 2 months now and I have tried to "stretch" them out, but they still hurt. The sound quality is great however and if you are using them for a short run I think these would be great. But it seems like an odd issue that you can not wear them for the day.

author: Amber Lennox
title: Not for petite or children
content: Amazing product for most.  I am petite and they are too big for my build.  If they had an adjustable strap along the back they would be perfect.

author: Genelle Viars
title: Great Headphones!
content: Love these headphones.  Comfortable to wear, don't go in the ear so I can still hear traffic sounds and people around me.  Long lasting - used them immediately on a 7 hour Ultra run and they never quit.  Love-Love-Love!!

author: roguemermaid
title: Excellent 👍
content: These are awesome!!! I love that you can still hear and be aware of what's going on without you without losing any quality of sound on calls or listening to music. They have a built-in speaker which I have never had a complaint from anyone that I've talked to by using them. I was a little skeptical of how they fit but after several uses I love them. My only complaint is I wish they were a bit more water resistant. I'm scared that as soon as they get in the first real rain they are going to die

author: Mary A. Davison
title: Documentation is not as good as the headphones
content: I talked with their support because it was not clear from the instructions which button was the on/off button...Seriously, you'd think that would be the first part of getting started.  Turns out the volume up button is the on/off button.  I use them with my Peloton, and they connect right away, but I have to be consistent in recharging because the conked out in the middle of a spinning class the other day.  My assumption (nothing in the docs) is that they stay on until you hit the on/off/volume + button, so the battery runs down.  Not sure. There's no light to tell me that they're on - the light is active when it's discovering a bluetooth connection, and is blue when charging is complete, but then it goes totally black.  No idea.  Still, they're light and easy to connect.

author: Michael F Altz
title: Ouch, stop it that hurts
content: These are extremely uncomfortable headphones.  The receiver/battery part sticks into the side of my head and after about an hour just starts to slowly give me a headache.  The hoop in the back is too big and catches on my collar while at work, this will not impact a workout, but is a little frustrating.  The seem far more durable then my last pair that broke after 3 months but for $80 I would have expected a better fit.

author: inmyopinion
title: He'll NEVER go back!
content:
Christmas present for our 37yo son. It didn't take him long to get used to them. He has called often to thank us -like when he was on a ladder, hands-free, taking his Christmas lights down-we talked and he was also available to his children playing in the yard/
He LOVES being wireless! Sound is great! Battery life is great! and I'll guess they're durable when you care for them responsibly. He's FUSSY! and he will NOT go back to being tied to or having his ears plugged or covered.

author: Dan M.
title: Best headphones ever
content: Love them. I have hearing loss in one ear and these headphones allow me to listen as if I had normal hearing since they are bone conduction.

author: Bmac1024
title: What a find!
content:
These things are awesome!  And let me start with noise cancelling, I gave that category 5 stars simply because it doesnt cancel out sounds. When I run on the road I want to hear noises behind me. And with these I can do that.
Next if you hate earbuds in your ear (I do) then these things are perfect!  I was unsure how good the sound would be, but I assure you the sound quality is fantastic. I have tried many over the ear devices and these are by far my favorite.
Give these a try, think you will really like them, I absolutely love mine!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Not so much
content: Just don't like the way they fit . very uncomfortable and gives me a headache. Just not for me

author: Holley J. Mangham
title: Great for a Slow Runner Like Me!
content: I wore these for the first time when I completed the St. Jude Half Marathon. I'm in the back of the pack, so it takes me about 4 hours. I had no battery issue. Plus it is nice to not have an earpiece slide from sweating.

author: Danielle
title: Excellent Bone Conducting Headphones
content: Love these, best bone conducting headphones I've ever had. Purchased some lower quality versions 2 years prior for PTC and was sorely disappointed.  I purchased these for PTC this year and absolutely loved them.  Sound quality was great, battery life was impressive and I did not have any issues with the sweat giving them problems.  I have continued to use them since for softball, excersize and gardening.  They have continue to work well and the quality has maintained.

author: Jamie J.
title: Desync in and out when paired to phone!!!!!!
content: The headphones are constantly cutting in and out. with that happening I can barely listen to any music. I have resynced, unpaired, hooked them up to different phone, made sure they were charged, made sure the phone was in range. To me personally I will never buy another pair. Other than that I had no issue. But I will say that it was in fact a waste of money. Im currently looking for another pair of headphones to buy.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Comfortable. Worth the $$$
content: I forget they are on, unless I'm going outdoors. Then I think my sunglasses are on and have to tell myself I don't wear glasses. Great audio, great distance, great battery life, great comfort. Must have for any tech, or active individual.

author: Robert O. Cox
title: Excellent sound for what it is.
content:
If you are a audio snob wanting the " Best sound " you can get transducer headphones are not for you.
For the rest of us these are excellent.
I use them with the Sleepo app.(A rain/white noise gen. Free btw.) to block out room noise so I can sleep. I get 10 Hrs of playing time and they have some charge left. They do shift some but not enough to matter. Add ear plugs and you are set.
  The sound is good enough that I will end up buying a second set to wear during the day. I like that you can turn them down and hear the sounds around you unlike regular ear buds.
Follow up note;
Had these for a while. NO problems with them at all.
They fit fine but you may want to try a set on if you have a small head

author: Alison Budelsky
title: Awesome for running
content: I paired these headphones with my Garmin Vivoactive Music watch and it has revolutionized my runs.  I could never get earbuds or any other type of headphones to stay in my ears, particularly if I am moving around.  These stay in place when I run, and I can still hear what is going on around me (so I don't get run over).  The sound quality is decent, but you don't buy these to sit in a quiet room and focus on the sound quality.  I highly recommend for active people who want to listen to music while out in the world and can't keep other headphones in their ears.

author: joe zabinski
title: These suck
content:
I tested these on display at a truck stop and they sounded great, so i ordered off Amazon because it was $50 cheaper

During calls these pick up all the background noise and to the listener you will sound muffled and distant.  These were promoted at the Loves to truck drivers, ABSOLUTELY NOT, my wife couldn't hear me over the truck.

As far as sound, again, very disappointing.  The sound is muffled, and the bass throbs against your bone and feels awkward.  The titanium model also after 15 minutes of use starts to really push against your temple area and becomes very uncomfortable

I was doing to return these immediately buy my wife decided she liked them for walking the dog so i kept them and let her have them

I STRONGLY do NOT recommend these

author: Timothy Kolodziejczak
title: Worth it
content:
I'm a picky guy with headphones. I hate wires. I hate Bluetooth. I hate in the ear plugs that fall out, don't fit, get nasty, get sweaty. I don't want some pod thing that I'm going to lose when I put it down, or it falls out. This headset solved all my problems. I don't care about some fanciful explanation on how they work, I just appreciate that they do. They're rigid but flexible, so you can manuever them or fit them however you want and you're barely aware of their presence. You can run climb jump, do whatever you want and they don't fall off. It doesn't blast directly into your ear drum, but their still loud enough for me to enjoy when I cut the grass or take the motorcycle out. Battery life is great and they've had quiet a few recharges at this point. Haven't had them die on me yet, which would make me want to throw them in a river. Bluetooth has never been a problem, they connect instantly and STAY connected.

All in all, worth my time and trouble to put thoughts into the review. I appreciate a company that makes a well thought out product. When I do eventually destroy these like I do all of my electronics, I won't have any problems giving these guys more of my money.

author: Lizz D
title: Great idea just need to figure out how to keep them in place
content: I like the idea of these. The only issue I came across is when I wear them with an ear warmer. I had to wear them a little different and depending on where they sit, the sound quality changes.
