Also, the size of my head isn’t quite as small as the minis and a little too small for the standard size. That’s just me and my head tho. Also, I’m not sure where they are supposed to sit in regards to the back of my head. When I’m running or doing plyometric moves, the back tends to fall down and when I turn my head up, it tends to get in the way.

author: Roger
title: These things are freaking amazing!
content: These things changed my freaking life! I can listen to books all day at work. I work in an industrial environment that requires me to wear earplugs, these headphones work best while wearing earplugs. If someone walks up to me, I can tap the pause button located at my left temple.

author: rcpost
title: Longer battery life
content: This is the best wireless headset I have owned. Comfort, charging and battery life is best yet. I bought based on having used my son’s pair and would definitely recommend them.

author: Fabian
title: What warranty?
content: I really enjoy these head phones and the last over 7 hours. How ever I give it 4 stars because it comes with a unusable warranty. Kind of a slap in the face. I tried a few times registering it and the site just has errors. Good head phones though you can feel some bass around your ears that kind of get you moving.

author: Jani Michielsen
title: Will change your life
content: I bought a set for my fiancé at Christmas and decided to get myself a set since my old headset finally died. These are amazing. If you want to be able to listen to music and clearly hear people around you, this will do just that. If you don’t want to hear them, it comes with ear plugs to block out noise. Totally worth the money!

author: Donschell J. Stallings
title: Good
content: My mom has a Samsung 8 and wanted earphones so this brand was recommended by a close friend. The quality of the headphones are not that great. There is an echo sound in the background and I’m working on seeing if there is a way to solve the problem. Otherwise she does not seem to have an issue with the headset.

author: Michael E. Pittman
title: Very satisfied
content: I received these and have used them several times now.  I am very satisfied with them.  What I like is they aren't inside the ear and yet I can hear them just like they were.  With the music playing I asked my wife if she could hear it and she said no.  I also have a in the ear headset made by Bose.  I must admit the base and sound quality are better with Bose but the quality with these are good enough.  With Bose  I am always adjusting the ear buds back in and they sometimes fall out.  With these that is not a problem as they are snug.  To be honest, I like these better.  I have received and made phone calls with this and the quality is great and the person I am talking to says I am loud and clear, no "tunnel" or "muffled" sound.  I would recommend these for sure.

author: ATB
title: Good not great
content: This unit is not designed for larger people.  My son is 14 and 6'3 and 170lbs. He found the headphone to be very close to his ear canal/opening. They could have a slightly longer arm for bigger people.  With that in mind , he still likes the unit.

author: Rays160
title: PH-E-NOM-IN-AL!!!
content: I have tried virtually every form of earphones/headphones on the market for when I am running. Nothing, and I mean nothing, compares to the Trekz Titaniums. Several runners in my office have now purchased them as a result of trying mine. It is awesome to go running and not have to worry about shifting earphones, or having to plug them back into the ears. These also allow for you to marginally hear what's going on around you (if you have the volume at lower levels). Otherwise, you can crank them up and hear perfectly your music while running. Great item and made my running so much more enjoyable! Thank you!!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Excellent way to listen to music
content: These headphones are fantastic.  I can hear well, while other conversations can be heard that surround me.  Good battery life, and can even answer my cell phone or make calls when I have the headset connected via bluetooth.  Great product.

author: Jamie Holland
title: Excellent sound quality!
content: I was looking for headphones that are very stable and not just hanging off my ears.  I heard these headphones in a camera store and wanted a pair!  I like that the sound quality is excellent and you can still hear if  someone is approaching you - I didn't want to be 'clueless' on hikes.  They are a little tight on the head at the beginning but I know the more I wear them, the better it will feel.  Very compact and easy to carry.  Very impressed!

author: Jerrod Smith
title: Perfect for Biking and Jogging
content: Awesome!! I had the Bluez2 for about 8 years before they finally broke from daily use. This design is even better. I have 50% hearing loss in one ear but hear great with these because of the bone conduction. Also, these headphones are perfect for biking and jogging so I can hear music and hear what is happening around me. I got the Aftershokz Air version too.  Both are great, the air is a little lighter and comfortable, The Titanium a bit more durable. I wear the Titanium at the gym and on the bike and the Air at home and in the office.

author: Yami
title: Great tech, great price, you can't go wrong here
content:
I love this headset! I can hear the world around me, which makes using them while walking outside or while on the office less annoying and potentially dangerous. Sound quality is great- don't expect Bose quality eargasms and you'll like them just fine. It's everything I need from a Bluetooth headset. Pairing is easy, connection distance is good, wearing them is comfortable.

I've had some trouble with them staying in place while I'm wearing glasses or a hat, but nothing with docking points for.

author: Patricia Fritz
title: Bone Headphones
content: My son said that unless he was holding his phone on his shoulder he could not hear his music.

author: Peter
title: Comfortable and clear
content: These were purchased as a gift for my wife. She says that they are the best headphones she has ever used. They are comfortable to wear all day. They stay in place when she is running or biking.

author: jenna
title: They're amazing!
content: These headphones are even better than I thought they would be! The only thing that took me a minute to get used to is that I had to wear earplugs with them to shut out all the noise. Which is totally fine with me because the sound quality is fantastic and you can't hear a thing on the outside with the earplugs in! Also, you don't have to wear them if noise around you doesn't bother you. You can still hear your music just fine without them! I workout with them every day and shutting out other people and noises going on around me is very important to keep my concentration! They are my absolute favorite headphones, I can't work out without them. Another thing about them that I love is that my battery life usually lasts 3-4 days! Glad I went with these over the Bose Sport!

author: J. Klinger
title: to large for my head
content: I am female and found these to big, I could not keep them on my ears, I do have a smaller head and the distance between the back of my head, to my ears is short, the sound quality was very good if I held them over my ears, sad I had to return

author: cloneluke
title: sturdy headphones, solid for biking or kids
content:
I can still hear whats going on around me while I listen to podcasts, etc

Not for audiophile, but good for everyday use in situations where you can't tune everything out.

author: M. Chen
title: Best bone conduction headphones
content: Perfect for outdoor running or cycling - where you have to watch out for cars. One star removed because call quality is not great. Very comfortable - I wear mine all day. Durable as it really bends so I don't have to worry when I chuck them in a bag. Battery life is good - can go a day listening to podcasts without any issues.

author: Troy Loberger
title: Cool idea - not quite there yet
content:
I really like the idea of the headset but i don't think it's worth buying quite yet. There are a few reasons why i say this:
1. I wear these climbing and mountain biking so i can pay attention to my surroundings. There are motions i can make with my head that pull the ends away from my head and interrupts the music
2. People often complain that they can't hear me well why talking on the phone through them.
3. When they are at 30% they will disconnect from my phone. That's a 1/3 of the battery life remaining.

Again, really cool idea but i wouldn't buy them at this time.

author: Ven
title: Horrible Bluetooth connection and significant audio dropout.
content:
If I could give this product zero stars, I would... That's how poor the audio quality is. I did a lot of research on bone conduction headphones, and I decided that these ones would best suit my needs. I could not have been more mistaken, and I truly regret purchasing this product. I will be returning it as soon as possible

While the product looks impressive, and while your phone is in your hand the connection is fantastic, once you put it in a pocket, that's when the problems begin... That's when this product truly sucks. Imagine you're driving your car down a back country road 250 miles from the nearest radio station, that's the audio quality that you get with these headphones. Want to listen to a song? Good Luck! Cuz that song is going to come in choppy, and you'll be lucky if you hear more than 50% of it. I have $20 JVC headphones that I swapped out for these ones that work infinitely better, and every other Bluetooth headphones I have at home are clearly more connected than these ones are.

I am absolutely shocked at how crappy the quality is, for the amount of money you're being charged, you would expect near 100%, crystal-clear audio connection between your phone and the headphones. Not the case here. And before you think  "well maybe you're running an old crappy phone?" Rest assured that is not the case. If I was, maybe, just maybe that would explain it, but Samsung Galaxy S 9? No, there is no reason for the audio to drop out as much as it does. The phone is literally less than two feet from my headphones in a back pocket, you cannot tell me that there is any sort of interference that should be in the way there, none at all. It's just a poorly designed, poorly built product. I am really disappointed with how bad these headphones have performed.

author: C79
title: Works With Hearing Aids
content: Very comfortable headset, once you get used to the fit and location of the bone conduction headphones. Like the fact that I can wear them and my hearing aids at the same time, great sound very pleased.  They work for my phone and MP4 player.

author: Katherine
title: They are not holding a charge
content: I was so excited to give these to my husband for his birthday. He used them right away but since then they will not hold a charge so we cannot use them. I am looking to return them if we can not figure out why this keeps happening

author: Ashley Pierson
title: Great for runners
content: I got these for my husband as I don’t usually run with music. He absolutely loves them. So I decided to try them and I can also say they are pretty darn awesome. No buds to fuss with!! We run distance and never had an issue. Battery life is great. We ran the Marine Corps Marathon and my husband still had battery in them at the finish. I am pleased.

author: becrazier
title: Painfully good. Then died.
content:
I have used AfterShokz bone conduction headphones for awhile. I love them other than I wish I could toggle back where I zone or and miss something important. When I first got my new titanium headphones I was estatic. They seem to be lighter, more durable and better soumd. However, they rub the top of my ears and get uncomfortable after a while. The older AfterShokz bone conduction headphones did not do that.

Upfate: it quit working after a month.

author: The Rebel
title: amazing for running or biking.
content: Not a great pair of headphones for listening, chillin on the sofa.  They’re amazing for running or biking.

author: Alden
title: AMAZING technology
content: Love these! They're phenomenal! Great for ANYTHING where you need to be able to hear what's going on around you but you still want to listen to music. And if you don't want to hear things use the ear plugs included and the noise is even louder!👍

author: JMK
title: Surprisingly Good Sound
content:
I got these because I cannot have earbuds in my ears and over the ear headphones just don’t work for me when I’m exercising — and I just don’t like them in certain situations. I was excited when this headset arrived. After charging, they easily paired with my iPhone and I tried them out. They fit well and are comfortable. More importantly, I was SHOCKED at the quality and the clarity of the sound. I even said, “Oh wow” when I first heard music using these.  I was initially hesitant because of the price, but I’m glad I got them. Five stars. If something happens to change my view, I’ll update this review.

A Tip: If you put them into pairing mode, and then press the button again, it gives you the battery level.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Love the way it works
content: My husband can't hear on the left side has been that way since birth. I purchased this so he can talk to me when he is driving but we got an added bonus he can hear out of his deaf ear was amazing to watch his face when he heard it the first time!!! This seems to bypass the problems with his ear because it sits on the bone and works that way wish they had hearing aids like this would be awesome! I highly recommend this product for everyone I'm so Thankful my son had one and loves it and thought his Dad would too!

author: Ron R.
title: Not for long term use.
content:
When properly positioned, the sound quality is adequate. They are however fantastically uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time, say over an hour or so.
Battery life is enough to get me through a shift.
Control is slightly unintuitive as there is no dedicated on/off switch, the volume up serves double duty.
Noise cancelling works maybe a tad too well, i got these because i am not allowed to have earbuds in both ears for safety reasons but with these on and volume on reasonable levels i can't hear anything at all of outaide world, not even someone speaking a few feet away.

author: Michael Zazueta
title: Dead after 2 1/2 months
content: I really liked these headphones. I have severe tinitus and these allow me to hear my music or movies a lot clearer than normal in-ear or over-ear headphones. However, I have to give this item only 2 stars because after 2 1/2 months they won't stay charged. After fully charging them, they will only last about 5 minutes now.  So, while I did like them, they need some serious work. And if the seller would like to contact me about it, that would be great.

author: Von
title: No bone for me.
content: It's pretty cool. But did not work for me.  Didn't feel it in my bones. Just heard the speakers and felt vibration. Too big around my head couldn't get a good placement on my head to feel the music.  Sadly

author: Frank Silva
title: I need more bass and more volume. I’m had of hearing.
content: The headphones fit OK. I like that they vibrate so I can feel the music. But I am not getting enough bass. I need more bass. Also, the battery linf is like one hour then you have to recharge. I am keeping them and will be using when I BBQ OR WHEN COOKING IN THE HIUSE. SORRY for yelling.

author: Kate Murphy
title: I LOVE THESE, but...
content:
I bought these to replace an older pair back when they were called Trekz.  My old Trekz still function but the plastic by the earpiece broke from normal wear and teat, making them unwearable.  I also wasn't able to repair them because the tension they use to hold them in place caused my repair attempts to fail.

I hope these last longer than the year or two that the last set lasted.

author: Agreen
title: Makes running alone safer!
content: These are really cool if you run/walk outside and need to hear what’s going on around you. Women, get these if you run alone! You can hear people coming up behind you while still getting great sound.

author: Andrew D
title: Great sound and functionality, but painful after long-term use.
content: On the whole it's a great idea. I bought these to use at work and, unfortunately, I am only able to wear them for about two hours before needing to take them off. The protective cover for the charge port features a tab to allow you to lift up the cover. That little tab rests on my right ear and after a while becomes very painful. If I were just using these for a 1-hour workout, there would be no issue. They are simply not suited for long-term use at a time.

author: china plate
title: struggling with fit
content:
I am a distance runner and loved the idea of wireless earphones. The only pair of earbuds that have ever worked for me (and my very small ears) are bose but they seem incompatible with my current phone, so I was especially happy to find this pair that don't have to fit in the ear. However, while the sound is pretty good when these are properly placed, I really struggle to wear them even walking and for sure running. They either hang down on my neck in a very uncomfortable way and then shift around as I run (either too close to my ear where they vibrate like crazy) or too far away where the sound isn't great OR they sit above my pony tail which displaces where they sit too much.

If they were able to make an adjustable headband for these, I'd love them I think but for right now, they don't fit my small head.

author: Robert Brown
title: Best headphones
content: These are truly amazing! My job requires that I be able to hear without hindrance, but allows headphones to improve morale. Others can only wear one earbud. These allow me to have stereo sound at conversational levels while being able to hear my work environment. They resist the dirt and grime and sweat. Fit me well and are very comfortable. When mowing or otherwise not needing to be able to hear around me, I'll put in the provided ear plugs and am able to just jam. The BEST part is despite stating 6 hour battery life, I get 10-12 hours out of these daily! And have for months. These headphones are the best of the best for workplace or running safety while getting great sound.

author: desiree whale
title: Best headphones
content: This is my first time using bone conduction headphones. Took a few times wearing them to get used to them but now I absolutely love them. And amazingly- when I take a phone call using them the other person hears me clearly. I didn’t think they would since they are so high up and away from your mouth. They are great because you can listen to music but still hear and be aware of your surroundings.

author: Linda  Davis
title: Great product, but needs a few adjustments to be really super.
content: I am blind, so it helps to be able to hear my music and hear the bus stop calls or train calls for next stop. However when there is a lot of traffic on the street and I am walking on the sidewalk it’s hard to hear the music. It is fairly comfortable, however the back bar is a bit big and would be better if it were adjustable. All in all I really like it.

author: MWG2
title: Not comfortable!
content: The bone "ear piece" presses hard against your head and is painful.  Not comfortable whatsoever.

author: Todd
title: These are excellent for runners who love music
content:
I can hear the music and the world around me as I run.  Best of both worlds.
I use them for about 3 25-minute runs a week.  I charge them about once every 5-6 weeks.  I cannot believe how long they hold a charge.  I hope that continues for awhile.  I have only had them since November.

author: Ronald James Colyer
title: Great sound without covering the ear - safe to wear!
content: Saw these on a neighbor who just started running. Since I’ve been running 40+ years and recently began to listen to podcasts, I gave it a try. Love them - paired with my iPod nano via Bluetooth.  Makes everything easier!

author: Rebekah Kohnke-Swoveland
title: They get me through my work day!
content: Easy to pair. Hardly notice I’m wearing them because they’re so light.

author: gmoney
title: Finally, quality reliable go-to headphones!
content:
Have been searching for headphones that:
* are wireless... without drama every time I need to connect it to my phone
* stay on, whatever I am doing
* good (enough) sound/mic quality for music or business calls
* have enough battery life to not be a limitation

Overall, I have been very happy with these - enough to compel me to write a review, which isn't usual for me.

author: R. Cunningham
title: Best Headphones Ever
content: Great product. Allows me to listen to podcasts, radio and music at work without tuning out my co-workers, Then being able to use real ear plugs on a plane or whenever you want to shut out the noise makes them sound awesome! The battery lasts ALL Day! Like I said best headphones ever!

author: Jose F. Garcia
title: Best Bone Conduction earphones I've had
content: They're flexible, something my previous ones were not. Great sound quality. they could improve some aspects but they work just right. I will definitely continue to buy AfterShokz products.

author: Blue Drache
title: Battery Life Depends on Application
content:
So far, I've had 8 hours + battery life in any application I've used it in.  I've talked on a phone call for over four hours, and finished out the shift with music using the VLC MP3 player on my android phone.  I've also just listened to music for 8+ hours with no issues.

The fit is one-size fits most, so if you have a smaller head, it's going to be a bit wonky.  It tugs a bit on the resting place if I look up.  Otherwise, it's good to go.  A co-worker also has these, and has a smaller head, but wears them higher up on the crown of his head, not behind the ears.

Also, the same co-worker says that the YouTube app drains his headset faster than ... say ... Audible.  So, again, YMMV.

I would definitely recommend these to a friend.

author: Shannon Becker
title: Would not recommend
content: I bought these at the end of November 2018. Today is June 2, 2019 and the left side no longer produces any sound. Every once in a while i’ll hear a static sound but that’s it. For what these cost I am very disappointed. They have never been near water only the sweat of long runs.

author: MeganS
title: Purchase these!
content:
Awesome for road running. Wished i wouldn’t have waited so long.
It was a little bit of an adjustment but now that I am used to them, I love them. It is difficult to wear a beanie or earwarmers though.
I can hear people talking to me and cars approaching on the road. I feel safer and more aware of my surroundings. I can also play the music very low and still carry on a conversation with my running buddies!

author: purple_butterfly1106
title: Good but not "bone conducting"
content: Yes they are light weight. But they are just speakers. Not really bone conducting in the sense that you can hear them through your bones

author: Tinker_Tech
title: Hyper focus engaged!
content: If you want mind-blowing sound these aren't the headphones for you. I don't use these to workout I just shove Earplugs in my ears and listen to books and music while I work. No distraction, hyper focus, and not ruining my hearing. Battery last all day and yes if you turn it way up people can hear what you are listening to. I originally purchased these so I could work on the shop floor and wear my PPE (personal protective equipment) "ear plugs". Which these are wonderful for.

author: Sly
title: Meh...
content: These headphones are just okay. They're probably only worth really $30-40.00 USD as the quality is extremely lackluster. I am disappointed, because they originally seemed promising. First of all, the sound quality is crackled. Secondly, if you're using these for talking on the phone, the other person typically can't hear you either AT ALL or it's very muffled. I've moved them around to ensure I have them fitted correctly, but it doesn't help any of these problems. They are most assuredly not worth the $80.00 price tag, unfortunately.

author: james wilson
title: Weary
content: Great headphones.  I ordered the BLUE ONES & got black.  I sent it back specifically stating I WANT BLUE, I got BLACK AGAIN!  I kept them and they’ working well.

author: NewAmsterdam
title: It was ok.. Until it broke after two weeks, left side stopped working...
content: It is nice to have nothing in your ear while listening to music / podcasts.. especially when running, or doing other activities. Sound quality was ok, but people around me could clearly hear the music coming out of my headphones. In addition, I stopped using them after the left side stopped working.. one and done..

author: Lisa
title: Happy with the bone conduction design.
content: My boyfriend and I bought them for each other. We like them. Have noticed that you should not lean your upper jaw on your hand while talking.... dead ends the souls for the person trying to hear you talk. Love that it’s not screeching in my EAR. Comfortable to wear. Sound quality is fine. Have only gotten to use it a few times. I’m a nurse.... wish we could use this instead of a phone at work, keeps my hands FREE.... and can still hear the sounds around you.

author: Andrew W. Camp
title: Absolutely love it!
content: I haven't found anything yet that I dislike about these. But I've only had them for a day. I wore them all day and at first I thought they may cause a headache, but it never did. It got more comfortable the more I wore it and in the end hardly knew it was there. I use it mostly for my work calls all day in my home office. I use two cell phones and it works for both at the same time! Yay! I love it. Good call quality. And music sounds fine to me. I don't think I'm going back to in ear headphones.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good solution for jogging
content:
I was looking for earphones for running / training that don’t fall out from my ears and this is now proven to work very well as it is open-ear. Very comfortable and stays in place.
It is obviously not noise cancelling as it is not blocking your ears, but that’s the whole idea. You still hear everything around you which is crucial if you jog outdoors.
The only real downside I’ve encountered is if I wear it for floor exercises, it gets in the way when I lay down.

author: Oliver
title: Painful to wear
content: These are uncomfortable as heck. They hurt behind my ears. I bought the Air model instead to see if that's any better. Sound is ok. I wouldn't buy them for music. I listen to books and podcasts. Ok for that.

author: Shepard Davis Jr.
title: Keeps you alert while on a trail or on the street.
content:
This product is a runners dream, enjoy your tunes and still be aware of everything around you. The sound quality is to my liking. When the volume is turned up a bit of bass kicks in. I am not an audio engineer by any means but a little thump and the vocals are still clear is a added bonus. Volume controls are easy to use and the pairing feature is simple. Answering phone calls, putting a call on hold or switching back to music keeps your feet moving to the beat without missing a stride.
Now, if you’re not in a situation where the advantage of this bone conductive device is needed the added ear plugs. With ear plugs you can pretty much drown out the majority of background noise.
So the package contains headphones, charger, ear plugs & instructions.

author: WG_2006
title: Worth the money
content: These work great. I hate having stuff in my ears.  These allow me to still hear what is going around me at work but I still can here my music.

author: Dave W
title: A good option when safety is more important than sound quality
content:
I bought these for trail running so I could hear when people were coming up behind me (I'm slow). I really like that I can hear ambient noise and still hear my music.

My only real issues with these are:
1.) They do put some pressure on the outer ear (to keep them on your head) so I have to limit use to around an hour.
2.) There is a very fine line between hearing your music and getting a buzzy sound on your skin. I never expected any kind of "bass" in these, but when I turn the audio up to hear a bit better, the drivers actually setup vibrations in my skin. I assume this is part of the bone conduction (and unavoidable), but it's good to know before purchasing.

Overall, I'm satisfied with the head set for shorter runs and some yard work.

author: Woodhunter
title: aftershokz
content: These have really good sound, don't really know about the noise cancellation or the moisture wicking part of them.  The only thing I haven't liked is if I put my phone on the charger and walk  a distance away the Bluetooth disconnects and will not automatic reconnect like other headsets I have used.  You have to manually reconnect every time.  Hearing without plugging your ears is defiantly nice.

author: Donald P. Simpson
title: Better than expected, and just right for my job
content:
I spent about a month researching headphones online. My job allows headphones, but realizing I am also getting older and a little more hard of hearing with every second, I needed something that allowed my ears not to be blocked - in case my coworkers needed my attention. The AfterShokz Trekz fit the bill nicely and have been a great addition to my daily work routine. They connected to my phone (iPhone 7) in about 3 seconds after following the directions, and have worked flawlessly my first day of using them. As they are not intended to block out everything except what I am listening to, but rather allowing me to monitor what is going on around me, they work perfectly for having background musing going. If you are looking for something to block out the noise, I would hesitate in recommending them as there are many more options for that kind of listening experience. I also ordered the recommended Hermitshell Hard Case - and I would highly recommend purchasing it as well. It carries the headphones, charging cord, and a USB wall charger very well.

As far as battery life, I have listened to music for over 7 hours today and have yet to use half the charge. Much longer than advertised.

author: Robert Lohman
title: Fit could be better
content:
First my "complaint".  I used the sizing guide offered by the manufacturer that indicated I needed the "normal" size.  I was WELL into the normal range and ordered it rather than the mini-size.  I am still not certain I made the right decision as these as there is a half inch between the back of them and my head so they go down until they "lock" in (there is still a gap).  As I had ordered a case at the same time I have already ditched the packaging.  I also wear glasses which makes a difference in how they fit.  I'm not certain they fit right, I'm not certain they don't.  Its the not knowing that is probably annoying as I have run with them and they are comfortable enough I guess?

They work like they claim.... well the function as they claim.  I don't know about the science behind them but I can have music playing and hold a normal conversation without the music interfering but when there is no conversation hear the music well.  Which is what I wanted.

Some adjust-ability would be an asset.  I'm giving them four stars - room for improvement but they work better than expected.  Ok the more I think about this the more the fit issue is an annoyance.  If three star is "this does what it says it does" then this gets one knocked off from that point for the fit issue.  I have tried for several runs now and while they fit ( think) they annoy me in that they bounce downward until they are resting pretty low on my neck - might be an issue with glasses but I do put this on then slide my glasses over them (not exactly comfortable but how it is suggested)

author: Train2Thrive
title: Was skeptical but these are fantastic
content:
I was hesitant to buy bone conduction headphones but as a cyclist I need to hear what is going on around me and can't have in ear earbuds.  AfterShokz are amazing---I can hear myself and others speak, I can hear vehicles around me---all while listening to music or audio books.  I'm not sure how they work in regard to receiving a phone call as I haven't used them for that yet.  All in all---buy them---you won't regret it.
1 little annoyance is that they bother me from time to time--usually after an hr or more of wear--at point where they clip over the ear---just a bit of pressure---easily resolved by adjusting them a bit.

author: Martinex
title: Still a disappointment
content: I replaced the "mini" version of these headphones hoping for a better fit.  These fit exactly the same.  What's worse the sound quality was exactly the same.  These phones provide no bass response whatsoever. Cranking the volume results in weird vibrations on my earlobes.  These may be useful for phone conversation but not for music.

author: francisco belen
title: Mixed opinion
content: This earphones have a good direction but in my opinion not quite there yet, in a quiet environment they are great but if there a little noise like a ac or fan it’s a little hard to hear and if you up the volume then feels a little uncomfortable. Other thing I noticed is you have to constantly move the earphones or headset. Again I like the idea of not having it on my ear and being able to listen around me

author: SIMON SAYS
title: Great headphones for work
content: I bought the more affordable model first, I  was a little price sensitive. I love the concept, but the design didn't fit comfortably around my ears. I had to return it and get this model. My only problem with this model is the price, the battery life and the user interface. I wish it lasted more than 8 hours. Also, when the battery is low or about to die, it just stop playing. No warning or indication. Off course, I wish it was cheater, but being new technology. It's understandable.

author: Larry E. Schultz
title: Good sound - healthy choice
content: It’s a good sound and a healthy choice not to have the music blast in your ear directly. Good battery life. Fast charging after initial charge. Used them while on the riding lawn mower and with the ear plugs, sound was good.

author: Shari Kalkstein
title: Doesn't feel good over the ears
content: I bought this for my training of my first half-marathon. However, they hurt the top of my ears with just a short amount of time.  When I take them off, I feel like they are still on for quite some time.  I can't fathom wearing them for a race. Needless to say, I am very disappointed and am pursuing returning for a refund. On the bright side, the sound was fine for music, the phone was ok. UPDATE: I have decided not to return them, as I found if I wear a headband, they stay in place and don't hurt my ears. I really did like the sound and the mic works well for phone usage as well...UPDATE ~ bought a new phone and they won’t sync. Please advise!!!!

author: Erica F Cymerman
title: Pleasantly surprised
content: I chose these to replace my broken beats headphones after a little research. I kept an open mind given some of the reviews. I was prepared for a different experience and was pleasantly surprised. I love being able to hear my surroundings and music at the same time. I like playing my music loud and was not disappointed by the maximum sound level at all. Sound quality doesn’t measure up to my old beats but I wasn’t expecting it to. The vibrations will take some getting used to but hasnt caused any problems yet. I also wear glasses and have no problem with wearing both at the same time.

author: CDJWH
title: I’m able to hear in stereo for the first time in my life!
content:
Wow! I’m 38 and deaf from birth in one ear. I had never heard Stereo sound until yesterday! This is probably the most life impacting thing I’ve ever bought. My ear canal is almost 100% closed up from birth but my cochlea is intact. I listened for several hours before it went dead the first time, charged it and stayed up till 4 am listening to music I grew up with for the first time. I can’t express how thankful and excited I truly am over these bone phones.

I never knew how to describe going through life with mono hearing, but a good friend said, “It’s got to be similar to listening to music in your car with only one speaker working.” And I imagine he’s right. I’ll never listen to music the same ever again!

author: Samantha Burke
title: Comforable
content: Stays on the head well, gives great sound and easy controls for pause and play, decent range for Bluetooth as well. I wear them doing chores around the house, at work, and even during 5ks ( the sweat does not make them uncomfortable and they typically do not move when you're sweating either.)

author: Consumer 2U
title: Not for active people who workout and sweat
content: First off these are a great pair of open ear headphones. The sound is amazingly rich and deep considering that they do not stick in the ear or over the ear. They are light weight and fairly comfortable to wear. But here the rub. These earphones are not sweat proof. I started experiencing intermittent sound cutout while at the gym, and sometimes losing all function for hours at a time. The headband is only slightly comfortable to wear unless you wear glasses with them and then its pretty much pressure behind the ears. All an all there is enough good to counter the bad but then my headband broke which triggered a return to Amazon. I wanted to like these headphones but they fell short of expectations. Too Bad.

author: Eric Sotag
title: Alot happier at work
content:
My colleagues used to complain that whenever I join the conference call I would be screaming to the entire office instead of just a call the reason was that I couldn't hear myself but thanks to aftershokz they don't go in my ear so I can hear myself and the call at the same time.
I would give 5 star but the sound quality isn't perfected yet

author: Amazon Customer
title: Super Nice Product Love it so far except...
content: This thing is so comfortable and diminutive I can sleep while wearing this, listening to (soft) music.  Delightful... until... the battery starts to run low.  I'm listening to soft classical music... soft... quiet... I'm drifting in and out of sleep.  When suddenly this blaringly loud (and lovely british) female voice starts yelling at me YOUR BATTERY IS LOW... RECHARGE!  I'm ripped out of sleep - holy cow.  Let the battery run low, eh?  I'm sleeping.  I'll be just fine.  No, five minutes later BATTERY LOW... RECHARGE (I almost her her say 'Damnit!'...  I know I said it.  So, be careful to make sure it is fully charged before attempting to sleep with it on your head!

author: M.K.
title: Great Product
content: Earbuds don't stay in for me. These were a great alternative. Allows you to listen to your music and what's going on around you too. The charge outlasts me when I go for a run. Owned them for months and still only charged them twice. Bought my wife a pair too.

author: Luv2Fish
title: Great for someone who has trouble hearing!
content: This headset is lightweight and durable.  Easy to charge and pair through Bluetooth.  You will have to remember several button combinations for various settings, but you can always carry the small manual with you.  This is perfect for someone who has a hard time hearing.  It's also nice if you need to be aware of your surroundings but still want to listen to music.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Uncomfortable
content: I was really hoping I'd love these and be able to wear them for my upcoming marathon, but I couldn't even stand them on for 5 minutes. The sound quality is good, and I like that you can hear your surroundings, but they didn't feel like they'd stay in place and it was uncomfortable to have it pressing on my head. Also very disappointed to have to pay $7.90 to return them.

author: Casey
title: Cheaply made for the 100.00 price tag
content: Not even 3 months into using them rubber caps for the speakers fell off, sounds good  i had to have them maxed out to hear the music while out running  if you put ear pulgs in sounds very good but that defeats the purpose of them being able to hear your surrounding, battery life if good at max i get about 9 to 10 hours of music time, comfort is ok  really start to irritate about 3 hours in could be just that i have a bigger head , overall rating i give it a 3.2 of 5

author: Elizabeth Gillway
title: Best headphones
content: Did a lot of research score I ordered this product. Don’t regret this purchase

author: Kristy Erwin
title: Comfort
content: These headphones are awesome. I have daith piercings and traditional headphones were extremely uncomfortable and I had stopped using them. I am so glad that I found these and I am back to listening to music again. I am absolutely thrilled with them. 🥳

author: Jill
title: Great sound quality!!
content: These are fantastic.  Superior sound to any ear buds I've ever used.  They don't slip on the head and they don't fall out!!  Very comfortable to wear.  Only downside is that at higher volumes you feel the vibration.  Of course, this is also a plus since it keeps you from listening to music that is too loud -- good gift for youngsters.  Bottom line:  I love them.

author: Ryan R
title: Save your long term hearing by sacrificing sound quality.
content:
I bought these knowing that I had to somehow plug my ear canals to get the full hearing experience. But what I didn't know, was that if you didn't plug your ears with earplugs or something along those lines, you'd have to turn the volume up so high that the speakers would be vibrating on your head, just hear them decently.

With earplugs in, the sound quality is just north of good. You won't get to hear all the details you may be used to with other earphones of the same price, but they do afford you better hearing health by not assaulting your eardrums for a length of time.

Unless you want to shut out the rest of the world while keeping your eardrums intact, these are the headphones you've been looking for. Otherwise, go with some earbuds that give you the high aural quality you know you deserve.

author: Jason
title: First Use with Trekz Titanium
content: I bought these for running.  I have a pair of Bluetooth in ear headphones that would loosen in my ear on longer runs due to sweat, even though they had the wings in the design.  If placed too far in my ear for a more snug fit, I would feel/hear the thump of my foot strike.  Also, when turning to look for traffic, the wire connecting the two buds would stick to my neck and pull on that side.  The Aftershokz design looked like it would solve all of these issues.  When I first connected them to my Apple Watch (which was a breeze) and wore them around the house, the sound was good but a bit thin on a couple songs.  I then rang with them the next day.  I had volume a little over half way, and it was on par with my in ear buds at a similar volume.  They were a tad bit uncomfortable at first on one side of my head.  However, after the first mile or two, my head adapted, and the discomfort faded.  I loved that they did not move on my temples at all.  The band around my head remained in place and didn’t touch my neck.  The sound was good and better on some songs than others.  I didn’t change the equalizer settings before the first run, which may help on the next run.  It was weird, as some others have noted, to hear the music AND the ambient sounds during the run.  I heard birds chirping and cars approaching, while Foo Fighters, Nirvana, STP, Gwen Stephani, and Big and Rich belted our tunes.  Very cool.

author: jim mason
title: Hearing in stereo for the first time in my life
content: Excellent product for people with hearing problems like mine. I'm almost deaf in my left ear, but with this device, I can hear in stereo.

author: Robert
title: Amazing headphones
content:
I work in manufacturing and these are very popular among my coworkers.  They sound great but still allow you to hear what is going on around you.  I bought my first pair over 2 years ago.  Lost it during a move so bought these as a replacement.  Like the flex headband so I don't have to worry about breaking it while taking it on/off.

The custumer service through aftershokz is amazing.  When my work place went to a no radio policy, these headphones were one of the options they would allow.  They worked with our local union to get use a discount code for us to use.

author: Shah269
title: it's not headphones....
content:
OK if you like to listen to music while you are running or walking around the house or doing housework then this is for you. But if you like to listen to music while at the gym and want "A wall of sound" wellllllllll....no.
Here is how it works...it turns your head into a resonator and bypasses your ear drums and injects music / sound into your inner ear. very cool tech.....BUT...that means your ear drums are still working....so that means two signals are hitting your brain at once...one from your ear drum and one via this machine. and that means which ever is louder wins! and if you are at the gym that means the gym wins. if you are at home / quiet office and it's quiet this device wins.
Pros:
1 it's really cool tech and well when it comes to ear hygiene it's the best because nothing goes into your ear!
2 everyone wants to try it out!
3 if you have any eardrum damage this will allow you to hear music better

cons
1 if you are in a room where the sound is higher than what this machine can produce the room wins!
2 the fit is so so
3 sound quality if so so

the future....
this little device could in theory give you augmented hearing / reality much like the google headset but for your ears so there is hope for the future .

------------------------------------------------
3 month review....
OMG OMG OMG I LOVE THIS THING!
ok i have no idea how or what happened.....now i can listen to this and ignore the outside world! NO JOKE! I can now listen to this at the gym and honestly i can't even hear the person working out next to me! it's perfect!

but still the fit is sort of so so ...if you are benching or laying down...it's not going to work very well.

author: CCC
title: No range, poor sound quality, andcallservice
content: Extremely disappointed in this product! But maybe I just got a bad one? Absolutely no range drop my phone in my pocket do you need breaks up constantly especially you trying to make a call also no charging brick very disappointed. Especially since I bought all the accessories to go with this unit. PS needed add this one in ! very rarely do I write a bad review maybe my expectations were too high?

author: Kindle Customer
title: Convenient
content: Very nice product. Easy to set up and easy to use. Nice sound quality and you don’t have to turn the volume way up in order to hear well. I especially like being able to hear what is going on around me at the same time as using the headphones.  Have only used a short time but so far so good.

author: Generic Name
title: Pretty decent headphones
content:
It is very meh. The sound quality is terrible and it only seems to pause youtube videos...it won't pause my vlc player...and it sounds very tinny. It is only good for working out

update: on my pc the sound is very meh at best but on my zen xifi 3 mp3 player..the audio quality is excellent. I am also using a bluetooth adapter for my pc so i am giving it 4 stars instead of 3

author: Eli Armstrong
title: Light, comfortable, convenient
content:
Pros
-They're comfortable, even for extended periods of time.
-They're very light and don't bounce around on your head when you move, so they're great for running.
-They don't cover your ears, so you can still hear your surroundings while you listen (This might be a con for some people)
-They connect via bluetooth, so there are no annoying chords to deal with.

Cons
-I noticed a dissapointing lack of bass when compared to the $10 Panasonic earbuds I've been using.
-They aren't adjustable, so they may be uncomfortable to people with different head/ear sizes/shapes.

I can't speak to the durability of this product as I haven't had it for very long. However, I will return to this review if/when they wear out. That way, you can know that they remain intact for at least as long as it has been since this review was posted.

author: S.C.A.
title: Very convenient but sound quality not the best
content: These are incredibly lightweight and I love how they fit snug when I'm running. Even most wireless headsets have lots of extra wiring between earbuds that flops around and slips to one side. These stay put. However, I can tell that the sound is much richer when I hold the headset closer to my head so that the bone conduction will work better. I almost returned these. Then I compared to another pair wireless buds and decided the fit and convenience are worth the slight degradation in sound quality. And those talking to me say that my voice is just fine. So, I use these for phone calls as well as music while working out. Not great quality, but a very versatile lightweight headset.

author: D. Hupp
title: Issues with the headphones
content: I recently received the headphones but will be returning it back.  I charged it as directed in the manual but it does not keep charge.  Used it twice and both times it stopped working after ten minutes.  Reached out to AfterShokz and have decided to return the product.  Giving it a two star rating because I was hopeful this would be a great product to use in preparation for my first marathon.  Also, when I submitted the warranty issues was told somebody would contact me in two days.  I followed up with AfterShokz after four days of not hearing from them.

author: Kurt A. Johnson
title: Great for cycling and wearing a helmet while listening to music!
content:
Is the sound quality the best? No. Is it comfortable as hell? Yes! Can I wear a helmet and listen to music while cycling? YES! Can I hear cars and people around me while listening to music? HECK YEA!

So are these perfect for everything I need em for? Absolutely!

author: Travis L.
title: Sound vs comfort
content: I think the controls are intuitive. The sound is reasonable to ear buds. I work in a very vise environment where I need ear plugs.So these are great. Only down side, is the ft and comfort. They are making my ears sore and I was borderline to get the mini base on their size chart, but I decided against it. So fit could be better. Not going to have super bass, bit these are really good. Like they say you can hear your environment while running and have your music.

author: dkc2011
title: Excellent Ear Bud Alternative
content: I have worn these several times now for running and am amazed at the sound quality. The feel does take some getting used to. The fit is a little loose but not uncomfortable. I'm so happy to have these as I can't stand having something inside my ear!  My only complaint is I ordered green and received pink. I believe this must be a quality control issue as the ear plugs that came with the headphones are green amd the label on the cellophane wrapping says green. However you can see clearly from the pictures they are pink amd came in a pink box. I didn't think it was worth an exchange.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Cool concept but not quite practical
content: I was looking for headphones that would stay in place and not fall out when I sweat, so I thought these (that are placed out of your ears, on your cheekbones) would be perfect. I wear sunglasses most of the time while running, and these really hurt my ears after a couple miles. I found myself constantly having to adjust - and the headset itself cannot be tightened just moved around. The buds need to be in a pretty specific place so you can hear the sound. I did try running without sunglasses and had similar problems with adjustment

author: Josafat Rodríguez
title: Great product!
content: I’m a heavy user of headphones or earphones either for exercising or business calls. This is a great product, the best I’ve used for this purpose as it allows you to listen and pay attention to the outside world while listening music or taking calls, this is crucial for security when walking, running, etc, and is also hygienic to the ear and protects it., the quality sound is great as well. The only reason why I’m  not giving a 5 star is because the frame is not very comfortable around the ear, and although it holds very good, it hurts after a while. I hope the manufacturer can do something about it, if they do it will be a perfect product.

author: slsch
title: Weird vibration
content: I have to turn these way up to hear them well enough to actually enjoy the music. By the time they are loud enough to hear properly the vibrations created on my tragus are too distracting.

author: Ana & Bea
title: Comfortable, worth the price
content: I love these headphones. The sound quality is good, plus I like the fact that I can still hear my surroundings. I use these at the gym while I'm lifting weights. The only drawback is that if you are laying flat on a bench you have to adjust the headband part to also lay flat which repositions the ear pieces. But overall, very comfortable and worth the money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Function nicely, but fragile
content: I really like these headphones, but they break way too easily. My son has broken two pairs in the past year, and I broke one as well. The rubber cover for the micro USB port stopped covering the port after about 3 weeks, but it didn't bother me too much. The final nail was when the spine snapped. It happened in the exact same spot for all three pairs. I am not rough with my headphones, but I do use them frequently.

author: Kindle Customer Marsha
title: Incredible quality And light weight.
content: Incredible sound quality while still leaving ears exposed to hear if someone approaches you for a conversation. Would buy again. Light weight. Most do not fit in my ears. These sit in front so that’s perfect!

author: Me'Chelle Montano
title: Best purchase I have ever made
content: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made!! I use them at work, the gym, and walking my dog!  The sound quality is perfect and they stay in place!

author: John J Romero
title: They’re awesome
content: Bought them for my wife because she cant handle the ear buds, she loves them. I like them because she can hear whats going on around her while still being able to enjoy her music.

author: S. Cohen
title: Pain in the neck...quite literally
content:
I initially liked this headset, and in some way still do. But it's downsides are considerable.

First, the highest level of volume gets drowned out by regular street traffic unless I use my fingers to keep the "earphones" pressed to my head.

Second, at max volume, I can feel the device throbbing and vibrating against my jawbone - not good.

Third, the device stopped connecting to my phone a few days ago, after only using it for about 3 months.

Fourth, and hopefully last, since i started using the headset, I developed a crick in my neck and strange tingly and pulsing sensations in my left arm, above and below my elbow. Sometimes it would shoot down to my fingers. I actually didn't see the connection of the device and these physical sensations until the device stopped working and the tingling started to diminish. Two rounds of acupuncture resolved the neck pain, but I continue to get the tingling and shooting pain (which I initially thought was a precursor to a heart attack), but less and less now that I no longer use it.

In summary, the device is a nice idea, but still needs more research and development before it's a healthy and reliable device.

And I have a fifth, Amazon won't let me return it.  So I'm stuck with a $100 headset that no longer works and caused me physical pain.

author: A. P.
title: Situational awareness!
content: Pretty good sound if one uses the ear plugs but that’s not the point. I like that I can hear my chosen audio and still be aware of my surroundings.

author: Matthew Blevins
title: Very nice
content: Works great.  I like to use it while running or hiking because you still can hear things unobstructed using your ears while listening to music.  Very good product.

author: Walter W Bate
title: Bluetooth transmission
content: I use this while biking & driving &  like it because it lets me listen to things while not blocking out important traffic noise. Sound is acceptable for that purpose. I am a little displeased with the Bluetooth transmission which gets spotty if my phone is in the back pocket of my biking shirt. It’s fine if I put it in a front shirt pocket. I’ve tried this multiple times & it’s consistent. This occurs with blogs & audible books so is not the source. I would not have thought being behind my back, 18 in away, would interfere.

author: Shantel
title: Great for work
content:
I bought these for my husband who needs to have situational awareness at work, but would also love some music or audiobook on because it can be boring. Since your ears stay open it's like turning music on in the room that no one else can hear instead of isolating you in your head.
He likes that they work even when he puts in his earplugs - he works with loud equipment. In fact you can usually hear it better with ear plugs. They fit under his hard hat. With winter started he has noticed  they aren't ideal with all his winter gear on because as the gear shifts it shifts the earphones from their optimal position. Aside from that they don't budge with normal activities.
Planning on getting a set for my mom who cleans houses and needs to be able to hear clients of they want to speak to her andy father in-law likes them because he can hear them well - he's a bit hard of hearing. He's a carpenter and it's handy for him to be able to communicate with his crew, but also listen to music.
They're nice when your exercising outside so you can hear people and cars approaching.

author: Danny
title: It's worth the money.
content:
Before I bought the Aftershokz, I bought the $50 alternative, It didn't last more than 4 months. There was many weak spots in its structure, it broke easily.  Bought this product and it was day and night, strong audio and well built.

My biggest negative to this product is that in order to give good audio it puts a lot of firm pressure on the temple area, giving me frequent headaches.

Update 09/2019:  After frequent use, the pressure has become non-existent or I've been used to the it that it doesn't affect me anymore.

Would recommend paying a premium for this bone conducting headset for its quality build and audio , But I wouldn't recommend these for a child.

author: Bill Mason
title: Noise cancellation quality  useless in a class 8 truck
content: Worthless for use in a truck. Noise cancelation doesn’t work worth a hoot innthe noisy invironment of a truck

author: Kindle Customer
title: Great for Running on the Road
content:
These are exactly what I needed for running in my neighborhood where there is no sidewalk and I am on the road with cars coming at me.  With the sound at a medium level I am still able to hear cars coming and prepare to get off of the road if needed.
  However, the quality of the sound is not what you would get from in-the-ear or 'muff' style headphones.  They do the trick for me during a workout, but may disappoint you if you are looking for something as a music purist.
  Finally, I also use these for phone conversations.  They work fine in areas with low background noise, but they are problematic in noisy restaurants.

author: PAW0515
title: I’ve started a trend at work.
content: Don’t waste your money buying cheaper brands. Go ahead and get these.

author: Jeremy
title: Aftershockz Bluetooth Headphones
content:
Sound quality is solid. Haven't tested the moisture wicking.
Range of bluetooth is about 20 ft, once at that range,sound quality and connectivity disconnect. buyer beware you must keep paired device within a specific range.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth the money
content: I love these headphones. The only issue I’ve had is that wind can sometimes interfere with it but nothing horrible. I purchased one for myself and loved them so much I ordered one for my husband & he lives them.

author: TSRace
title: One of my favorites
content: Just got these yesterday and used them on a flight today. Wearing them is pretty comfortable. They sounded better than earbuds on the plane. These are not so great to hang around your neck when not using. It feels like a weak midget trying to grab your neck. Overall these are among my favorite Bluetooth headsets

author: Sutton
title: Listening to music only, not for talking on.
content: Awesome sound quality for music, terrible for carrying a conversation, so many times I was told I sound funny, there's an echo and it sounds like I'm on a radio. This is with 3 different co-workers.

author: Jon K
title: Great for morning traffic workouts
content:
First things first, there is no way that "sound quality" really compares to over-the-ear headsets. You're NOT buying these for sound quality. Because they rely on bone conduction, they let you hear your music AND the traffic around you. They're also waterproof enough to survive 5yrs of S FL rains and don't let beach sand into the speaker outputs.

This is my 2nd pair in 5yrs. Still don't know what happened to the orig pair but first the antenna started failing and then the whole device died (entropy FTL). That being said, they DID survive 5yrs of S Florida rain and 3-4days/wk of abuse. Are they cheap? No but I more than got my $ out of the first pair so yeah, I ordered a 2nd.

***Caveat: Speaker phone seems to suck in coastal/high wind situations.

author: Sonjia
title: Does not adjust. If my head was any smaller I would have had to exchange for the mini
content: I wear hearing aid and was having a hard time finding the right pair of headphones. What a pain it was to switch from headphone to hearing aids. Not a problem anymore!! I can listen to music and still hear around me not missing out on conversation at the gym and work were it can be loud. So far so good on the sweat. I did read other reviews saying they had issues with that but at this point I have not had a problem. Sound is amazing. Very clear. Very easy to connect . Definitely worth the money.

author: Julian Nott
title: Amazing item - but not waterproof
content: This is the first bone conduction headphone I ever used and it is amazing.  LOVE IT.  But note it is not waterproof, not suitable for swimming.

author: Jeff Railsback
title: Maintance situational awareness comfortably
content:
Part of my commute to work (by bicycle) is on the road and I wanted to be able to listen to podcasts and music while also being able to CLEARLY hear the sounds around me, specifically cards or any unwanted sounds from my bike signalling "I need maintenance!" A friend recommended these and I am pretty happy with them.

Others have posted photos of how they rest on your head/in front of your ears, so I'll spare you that explanation.  Typically, I'm wearing these with both sunglasses and a bike helmet and these go on the last and I then adjust the sunglasses to fit comfortably with these.

The buttons on the device are great.  I am able to adjust the volume with my right hand and pause whatever I am listening to by tapping the button on the left earpiece.

A word on the volume controls: When you first start out, make sure to adjust the volume high and then lower it to your preference. When I first put these on I was disappointed at how quiet they were until I realized I could increase the volume on these headphones independently of the volume control on my phone.  Ultimately I am happy with the volume these can achieve.

This is not a product for audiophiles. If you are focused on achieving perfect sound quality, this is not the item for you. This item is for people who would like to be able to listen while also being able to clearly hear things around them in their environment.

Battery life is approximately 4 hours. I had these running continually on a 5 hour ride yesterday and they stopped around the 3.5 hour mark and that was with a little bit of use the day prior, so I can reliably say they'll last 4 to 4.5 hours.  When the battery gets low every 5 minutes or so it pause your music and say "charge me" until it shuts off around 30 minutes later.

Overall, I'm happy with this purchase.  I do recommend these.  I almost never write legitimate reviews but these were worth it to me and I'm sure the similar models are likewise worthwhile.

author: Keith Rockow
title: size matters
content: great device, i can use it under a variety of conditions and still hear whats happening around me.  one draw back is the size perhaps a 1/4  inch larger / longer would fit perfect on my big head.

author: Jennifer Rawls
title: Good product
content: I got these for running 5ks and such, wanting to be able to hear around me.  Definitely can't use them while mowing,  hahaha - but they are fantastic for running.  They are the tiniest bit loose on my head.  I dont think it will be an issue.

author: ThriftyWoodWorks_Com
title: They work, but barely bone conducting, doubt they are much safer
content:
I purchased these for road cycling.  I was hoping for the ability to listen to music while still having the safety of hearing cars.  They work, but I can't really say they are any safer than any other headphones, and they are not super comfortable.

Bone Conducting - It works, you can test this by plugging your ear canals.  You can still hear the music, but super quiet.  To hear at any great volume you have to turn the volume way up.  And that is the problem.  Most of the sound you hear when wearing these is sound coming in through your ear canal.  So there is little different between these and other over the ear headphones that don't have noise isolation.  When riding on a busy road, I have to crank the music up way loud to hear it, but this starts to impede on my ability to hear traffic.  THEY JUST DON'T LIVE UP TO THE HYPE ABOUT SAFETY.

Comfort - They are not nearly as comfortable as other headphones, I don't think anyone can argue otherwise.

I will continue to use them sporadically, but I will be on the lookout for another solution.

author: virginia
title: Good clear sound quality
content: The speakerphones have a clear sound and like that I do not have to cover my ears, however the design is not very comfortable.  I would like it to be adjustable to the head. The way it is hangs under my hair messing  it up, or getting cut with the collar of my jacket. The wire is too loose. It will be great if it would be not just one piece but two, to hang on each ear - however is one of the best I could find in wireless.

author: lovinlife
title: Very durable for bone-conducting headphones good enough quality all around.
content:
This is my 5th pair I've own over the last 3 or 4 years because I like them a lot and prefer to own two at a time. I've owned other bone conducting head brands and always accidentally snapped the arms at the ear hook.  This is the only brand that can survive my abuse and lack of using a case.  The first pair I retired because it wouldn't hold a charge after 2 years but I used it every day so that's pretty normal. The second pair I accidentally ran over with my office chair. I don't know how I snapped the arm on the 3rd pair but they were thrown in my backpack unprotected  I'm still using the 4th and 5th pair.

The only complaint is that sound quality of a call is as good as any other ear based Bluetooth I've used, good but not great,  but some people struggle to hear me. it also picks up small background sounds from all around.

The sound of music and my audiobooks is plenty fine. It's not the most amazing sound quality I've ever heard but it's definitely good enough.

the one reason I like this brand particularly is that they don't over squeeze the head like some of the hard plastic ones I've used.

author: Elluminati
title: I like em but not for calls
content: Not the best for calls, in noisy situations.... Good open ear design... Feels like you're thinking the music

author: Emily Cho
title: great for runners
content: I love this. I have used aftershockz before so wasn’t worried about the quality of the product itself. But I needed earphones that stayed on while I’m on the running machine. And it’s not too sensitive to my hand movements. I love it. Definitely recommend to runners.

author: gndc
title: Perform perfectly!  For runners that want to be aware of their surroundings while using headphones
content: This should be a 5 star review, but the review questions do not reflect the actual product use. It asked how the product performed for moisture wicking and noise cancellation?  Not what these headphones do. Fit is good, features are good, sound quality is excellent. Ambient sound awareness is outstanding. Highly recommended if you want to listen to headphones ANDbe aware of your surroundings. Great safety for runners!

author: Nathan
title: Work Brilliantly
content: I like them alot.  I like the ear plugs for "sound canceling".  Use them everyday for work.  Wish I would have gotten the airs but was hesitant if i would like bone conduction headphones and the Titanium's had a lower price point.  I am very happy with them.  They do a little better with voice (audio books, pod casts, even on 1.5 and 2x playback) and calls than music.

author: Cade
title: one size that doesnt fit
content: I bought these for my girlfriend for christmas because she wanted new headphones. She says earbuds always fall out of her ear but big over ear headphones, like Beats, are too bulky. My coworker had these and so I thought they might work for her. My co worker told me he didn't really like them but I didn't listen. So these ones are just one size, cant adjust them and they don't fit her head or my head very well. I know there's a smaller size but I dont think those would really fit either. Maybe we both just have big heads lol. But in any case, I  had high hopes for them but they dont fit comfortably.

author: kindle krazy
title: Good sound quality. Holds charge all day!
content: I use the aftershockz for listening to Audible books every day. The sound quality is good! They don’t keep out ambient noises, but I want to be able to hear what’s going on in my house while I’m listening. Also perfect for safety when running/walking.

author: Rye
title: YASSSS!!!
content: So, these are AWESOME. I LOVE THEM! They sound amazing and I run at night and in the morning when it's still dark and being able to have great sound and still be aware of what's going on around me is awesome. They also come with reflective strips, which is awesome!

author: Joseph H. Wolff
title: Great design and quality but lacking in some areas
content: Nice product to give my ears a rest from podcasts and books on tape... however not very good in noisy environments... will continue to use my old plantronics when needed

author: J. H. Rios
title: Great buy!! Except.....
content:
I haven't had it for long but I love it!
I was bragging to all my co-workers that I had the ability to listen with both ears and not get in trouble with the managers because technically it was safe for the work space. I could react if somebody said "WATCH OUT!"

I was very happy with my purchase until....

The right ear stopped working. I can't hear anything out of it but a very faint buzz. Like someone turned the volume on the right ear down to 0.5. I've disconnected. Reset. And reconnected with other devices and nada.

What happened to it? I don't know.
Was it me? Did I use it too much? Did I hit it against something while putting it away? I don't know ... All I know is I am not in the position to buy another one and I'm sad that this great piece of technology lasted for as long as it did.

If it was 15 bucks if buy another. But it's not. Far from it. Therefore, I am leaving a 4 star.
It was working fine until it wasn't.

I would still buy this again....maybe upgrade to the 3rd Gen.
But I need to budget for it.

Don't let my review discourage you from buying this. It is a great set.

author: Doon
title: Love them.
content:
These headphones are great for people that want to have situational awareness. Since the headphones do not go directly into the ear you have a great sense of what is going on around you with out compromising sound. I would highly recommend these to off duty law enforcement officers and females working out or running. I'm a 20+ year LEO Vet.

I can get about 5 plus workouts a little more then an hour each out of a single charge.

author: Mikev
title: Weeks of using it and love it
content: I have been using this product for a couple weeks now and I love it. No more of ear buds falling out. It's a pleasure to be about to listen to music or whatever I am doing on my phone without the constant jiggling I used to do with ear buds. It also works great when I use it for my work computer for Skype calls. The 80 bucks was so worth it.

author: Daniel A Samec
title: Great Headphones for the Gym
content: I love working out with these headphones.  I can listen to music without the wires, but other people can get my attention pretty easily.  The battery seems to last long and charges quickly.  They are comfortable when I work out, but less so when I am just sitting around.  People don’t notice the darker version on my head as they blend in with my hair.  They connect quickly and easily with the Bluetooth on my phone.

author: Karen
title: Only okay
content: I have tried several different sets of headphones so that I could listen to music while working out and/or being active. The big over ear headphones are too clunky. The earbuds fall out when you’re trying to jog or be active. So I thought these would be great… The good news is they don’t move around or fall off when you’re trying to exercise. The bad news is that the speakers are too far forward in front of your ears, you can’t really hear the music that well and if you try to turn it up it vibrates against your head.

author: Alejandro Ortiz
title: Gran Calidad!!!
content:
Estos audifonos estan diseñados para correr en exteriores y no perder la conciencia situacional.
Si haces deporte al aire libre estos son tu mejor opción, puedes hacer cualquier ejercicio y escuchar perfectamente que sucede a tu alrededor.
Son muy ligeros, tienen un buen rango de volumen, la batería dura bastante, son a prueba de humedad (no te metas a la alberca con ellos), se acomodan bastante bien a la parte superior de las orejas y al correr no se caen.
Como trabajan a traves de Bluetooth evitas los molestos cables.

author: Matt Webber
title: If you sweat a lot, look for something else.
content:
These headphones were fantastic when they worked (the reason for 2 stars). Unfortunately, they aren’t as water resistant as advertised.

I am a profuse sweater by nature. And after about 3 months they started experiencing some issues. The Bluetooth controls began acting funny (not skipping songs on a double click, etc.). After 5 months, I was no longer able to pause and resume songs. Finally, after 6 months the sound began sounding tinny and then gave out entirely.

Overall, if you are looking for something with good durability (especially if you sweat as much as myself), find a different option.

author: MAVT
title: Work as advertised, get them
content:
Perfect for what they are designed to do, this are not regular in or over the ear so dont expect the same sound quality but they still sound very clear

Very nice clear sound, so so bass

If you listen to them more than about 80% volume the bass will make the inside of your ear tingle

For the price they are great, I got a different pair for $40 and you can definitely see the difference on sound and quality

author: DAAscia
title: Not what I expected, but it does it's purpose!
content:
Honestly I wouldn't actually consider this bone conducting. Its more like a speaker that's close to your ear so you can hear it. I did plug my ears while wearing them and still had decent sound quality.My boyfriend said he could just barely hear the noise when I was wearing them, and I put them on the table and could hear it in a silent room. So it's a speaker. That being said, the sound leakage is not overwhelming  as long as you don't have them up high.

If you want them for the purpose of hearing your music while also hearing the world around you, then it's perfect for that. Absolutely perfect. Call quality during phone calls was good as well.

All in all they're great for the purpose their meant for. Hearing the world while hearing your music.

author: A Bateman
title: Great Sound, But uncomfortable
content:
I use this earphones for a daily use of hearing music and answering calls. To hear music works fine in every conditions. To have a call, you can hear ok in noisy environments but the others can barely hear and understand you.

But what I really don't like about this earphone it's that they aren't comfortable to use. After 1 hour of use, is hard to keep them on.

author: BP
title: Great for hearing impairment!
content: I bought these headphones for my grandmother who loves to listen to audio books. She couldn't be happier! The sound quality is great, battery has an honestly GREAT life time when it comes to listening, and it delivers even when she wears it over her oxygen and hearing aid and glasses. Even works great with phone calls for her! She can finally hear even though normal hearing for her requires two hearing aids, she can take them off for a while and sit back to enjoy her audio books. I also have a pair of trekz air myself and I couldn't recommend this brand more!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing sound and still part of reality
content:
These speakers are so versatile.  I bought them for running to allow me to hear the world around me, but have found them to do so much more.  A friend had a set and I tried them for a run.  Now I use them on the bike, hanging out in the garage, the motorcycle (speed dependent), and even working around the house.  Completely able to converse and still listen to music or cut the world off.

Must have

author: Aupapillon
title: So impressed !!!
content: These are fantastic! It’s so great to talk on the phone without the feeling that I’m in a sink. It was like talking with your finger in your ear before I found this headset. I’m impressed with the quality and clarity of the sound, so user friendly and the range is great !!!

author: Arizona Smith
title: Volume is decreasing over time
content: I like the idea. I hate wires, and don't really want noise cancellation. But I have two problems with these headphones - First I wear glasses and contrary to your claims these just don't work either over or under the temples. Very uncomfortable. The other is the volume seems to be decreasing over time. I have had them for about 5 months and it just gets lower and lower.  It's to the point now where I can't even hear my sound over a car driving past on the street. Seriously. I have to wear the earplugs all the time, which always makes me nervous when I am walking. I like to hear what's happening around me.

author: Liszt
title: Not for sound quality, but multipurpose.
content:
