It's important to note what these are actually for. If you're in the woods and want to either appreciate the sounds around you or be aware of animals that might be nearby, these are for you. If you want hearing protection while working in a factory, shooting, mowing, etc, these are for you (if you use earplugs, which the pack includes). If you work in an environment that requires you to listen to your surroundings but doesn't necessarily restrict headphones, these are for you.
If you want to block out the world around you, a screaming child or the drone of an airplane. These aren't for you. If you want the clearest sound quality possible, these definitely aren't for you.
These fulfill a niche need, and not much else. If I had one grievance with the actual set up, keeping that in mind, it's that at high volumes they vibrate. After an hour of use, I stopped noticing.
Keep in mind what you will be using these for when you buy it. I just happen to fit a lot of these applications, and for the rest, I have a $200 pair of cans I can use.

author: cbosch
title: Greatest thing since sliced bread
content:
I have gone through a few pairs of these, only because of our puppy likes chewing them, and I love them and keep coming back to them. My cousin first showed them to me and thought they were pretty nifty. Took me awhile before I actually purchased them since I had other wireless headphones but once my old pair died I purchased these to replace them.

These headphones are great for wearing all day. I can listen to music while I work but if someone comes up to my desk I can hear them just fine. I could see these being very helpful while on public transit, listening to music or a show but also being able to hear your stop coming up next, instead of always having to look up to see if your stop is coming up.

I also recently took these on a trip. With the included ear plugs I was able to block out all airplane noise. Even my previous active noise canceling headphones couldn't do that. Not only did it block out all the background noise but the sound quality goes from 3/5 stars to 5/5. You get real deep bass, if that's your thing, noise canceling, and the ability to wear them in public while not shutting everything out if you still need to pay attention.

These headphones also allow you to be paired to multiple devices at once. This is great if you are normally listening to music from your phone but now you want to watch a movie on your iPad or laptop it will automatically shift over to whatever is playing sound without having to pair and re-pair. It did take me reading the directions when I got my newest pair to figure that out but now I don't have to worry about it.

Overall these headphones are perfect. Great sound, long battery, and you can still hear things going on around you.

author: Tamingthesquirrel
title: Great Headphones for anybody that needs to hear outside noise
content:
I got Trekz Titanium because I did not feel safe running with traditional in ear, earbuds. I often couldn't hear cars, people, or other dogs and relied on my sight for safety. These headphones allow me to listen to podcasts, music, and audiobooks while running, all while being able to hear everything around me. I use these exclusively around the house because it allows me to hear my son if he needs me or able to hear other noise around the house.

Sound quality wise, it is pretty good, and I definitely enjoy listening music and podcasts with them. It is not the best, but it is surprisingly good for conduction headphones. I gave it four stars because the loop that goes over the top of your ears does settle and dig into your ears, which can be uncomfortable. Because of it being a conduction headphone, I don't know how you can design a better band to relieve the pressure from top of the ears, but that is my only complaint.

Battery life is about 4 to 5 hours of listening and the headphone does a good job charging pretty fast.

Overall, these are my go-to headphones and I highly recommend them to everyone that needs to hear ambient noise while listening to their favorite stuff.

author: David G
title: Best set of Head Phones ive ever used.
content: Great set of Head Phones, the only thing you need to get use too is feeling the bass. Fits very nice around the ears with very little weight. I have a large head so these fit fine, they do sell a smaller pair so Im not sure if they would fit better.

author: Ralph
title: Great for running
content: I love my AfterShokz!  As a runner, I want to be aware of what’s going on around me, like dogs, cars, etc.  The AfterShokz bone conduction headphones fill that need.  I can listen to music yet still hear nearby environmental sounds.  Sound quality is good.
